description: Blue Train Murder Murder Case is based off of a book by Kyoutarou Nishimura with the same name, published in 1978, which was his first installment of railway mysteries. This adventure game starts with a murder incident on a blue train (in Japan, blue trains are long-distance sleeper trains named after their overall color), and you will switch controls between three different detectives in order to fully clarify the mystery. During your investigation there are no wrong choices which may result in your being killed or game over. You can take your time to go about the clues, investigate suspects and solve the mystery behind the murder.
title: Nishimura Kyōtarō Mystery: Blue Train Satsujin Jiken

description: CrossFire is a side-scrolling run-and-gun somewhat reminiscent of Contra series, although played at a slower pace. All that is known about the plot is that you are Eric the soldier and you single-handedly fight evil all over the world, from Vietnam to Colombia. You start with your fists and grenades, but soon obtain a sub-machine gun which can be upgraded to spread shot and even to rocket launcher. The upgrades are usually located in breakable crates. Unlike most Contra games, Eric doesn't die in a single hit, but has a lifebar which is partially replenished or extended every time he picks up a weapon upgrade or a medal.

sample_screenshots.caption: Hey, and this flying guy! I meet him every day when I drive to work!
Afghan boss. All the military setting and feel is wasted when you see a fantasy boss like this.
Further in Vladivostok - destroying some planes

title: CrossFire

description: Kyōryū Sentai Zyuranger is an action platform game based on Japanese TV show of the same name which later inspired US TV series Power Rangers. As in the show, the villain witch Bandora is plotting an evil scheme and zyurangers set out to stop her. The game consists of five stages each ending with a boss fight. Each stage is assigned to one of five zyurangers. The ranger starts with a blaster, but by entering a door halfway through the stage he gets his respective legendary weapon. Legendary weapons are stronger than the blaster, but in most cases have limited attack range. If the player collects ten coins scattered in the stage, a picture of zyuranger's respective mecha is shown and the ranger's health is fully replenished. Between the stages the player is challenged to one of three possible minigames: a simple quiz, a pong-like game or a bomb toss game. These minigames can be selected and played from the main menu, with the latter two available for two-player mode. The game has a password feature.

sample_screenshots.caption: When 10 coins are collected you're shown a picture of zyuranger's mecha, and health is fully replenished
Evil witch Bandora introduces her evil plot
Enter the door halfway through the stage and acquire the legendary weapon

title: Kyōryū Sentai Zyuranger

description: In Exciting Soccer: Konami Cup you must choose from one of six pre-made teams and lead them through the Konami Cup, by playing against the other teams twice, making for a total of ten matches. Each team has different qualities and strengths in five different values. They are "Kick", "Running", "Dribble", "Defence" and "Luck". After each match you can spend extra points to raise one or more values. If you make it to the top of the league table at the end of the season you win the game. Besides the "Cup Mode" you can choose to play a game against another human player. The playing field is seen from an overhead view and the gameplay is arcade-style and action-oriented, leaving out many soccer rules like fouls and offside.

sample_screenshots.caption: Results of the day and league table

title: Exciting Soccer: Konami Cup

description: Matsumoto Tōru no Kabushiki Hisshōgaku is a stock trading simulation game for which Tōru Matsumoto, a famous Japanese business analyst and writer of books about stock markets lent his name. The goal of the game is to increase your starting money of 1 million yen to a total of 100 million yen in a time span of two years. You have a limited amount of actions per day in which you can buy/sell stocks, buy information from several sources like newspapers or consulting charts. Every action as well as time itself decreases personal energy, which can be filled up again by doing leisure activities.
title: Matsumoto Tōru no Kabushiki Hisshōgaku

description: Nagagutsu o Haita Neko: Sekai Isshū 80 Nichi Daibōken is an action-platformer game based on a 70s anime movie starring a cat named Pero in a bet that he can travel around the world in 80 days, with the general plot being heavily inspired by the classic novel "Around the World in Eighty Days" by Jules Verne. The game consists of eight stages each in a different place of the world. While some stages have you walking and jumping around in mostly side-scrolling scenes, there are also many stages that have you travel by different methods, like boats, a car, a submarine or in a balloon. Gameplay consists of jumping, dodging and shooting enemies, while you always have to try to make fast progress because there is only a limited amount of time to complete the game, and it means "Game Over" when the 80 days ingame time is over even if there are still lives left.
title: Nagagutsu o Haita Neko: Sekai Isshū 80 Nichi Daibōken

description: Morita Shōgi is a Famicom adaption of the Japanese board game "Shōgi", which plays similar to chess. It is the second Shōgi game released for the Nintendo Famicom in Japan. The game lets you choose from a couple of game modes. You can play a game against another human player or a CPU player which comes in three different difficulty levels. The game also gives you extensive editing options, giving you the opportunity to create a board setup of your liking, placing the Shōgi pieces wherever you want. The game also lets a player interrupt a current game and go back and forth through the moves.

sample_screenshots.caption: Start of a game and main menu.

title: Morita Shōgi

description: Tetsuwan Atom (also known as Astro Boy) is a side-scrolling platformer based on the famous Japanese manga and anime series by Osamu Tezuka. Thieves have stolen all the money from Professor Ochanomizu and you in the role Astro Boy are send out to retrieve it. The game features ten more or less linear stages. In some stages you can only make progress after finishing certain tasks or solving little puzzles, like finding keys or special items or repeating a certain sound with bells. At certain places Astro Boy must also make use of his jetpack, which can only be used a certain amount of time, after which you have to wait a bit until it has cooled down enough for reuse. Astro Boy's remaining life energy is determined by an uranium value. This can be filled up again a few times by calling Professor Ochanomizu.
title: Tetsuwan Atom

description: Pro Yakyuu Family Stadium '87 is very similar to its predecessor Pro Yakyuu Family Stadium aka R.B.I. Baseball. Nothing changed in regards of gameplay, graphics or music. The only change are more teams (twelve instead of ten) and updated team rosters and stats. As before you can choose between a 1-player or 2-player game or watch two computer teams play against each other.

sample_screenshots.caption: Screen switches to top-down view after hitting the ball.

title: Pro Yakyū Family Stadium '87

description: Family Trainer: Jogging Race is the fourth game in Bandai's Family Trainer game series for the Powerpad peripheral. The game features two game modes. The first is a training mode. You define your stats (weight, height, age) and the time or distance you want to train. The second mode is a so called marathon mode, which is divided into smaller stages of 3km. In marathon mode you must also be aware of various obstacles on your way.

sample_screenshots.caption: What distance do you want to run?
Will he make it to the end?
At the start of the marathon.
How long do you want to run?

title: Family Trainer: Jogging Race

description: 19: Neunzehn is a strategy game in which the player takes the role of one of four leaders in his fight for the possession of an ancient artifact, a stone left behind by the Olympian gods. The player can choose between one of the four leaders, which represent "mountain", "forest", "sand" and "water" each starting in their respective environment of the overworld map. Troops of each faction have different values in stats like melee or long-range attack and movement. When it comes to battle the screen changes to a single-screen hexagonal battlefield map. You have a certain amount of action points for each of your units. After you have determined your actions, the game executes each command simultaneously, so it is important for the player to anticipate his opponent's moves beforehand. By winning battles, your surviving troops get experience, eventually leading to a troop upgrade, which increases stats.

sample_screenshots.caption: At the start of a new game playing the green forest faction.
The victory of the forest faction is only a matter of time.

title: 19: Neunzehn

description: Karaoke Studio is a Karaoke based video game where the player sings along to a selection of songs with the help of a microphone peripheral that came with the game and was attached directly to the game cartridge. The game features a total of fifteen songs, each of them presented in a graphical sequence and with the song's text displayed at the bottom of the screen. The game features four different game modes. The first mode is a "Lesson" mode, where the player can freely choose a song to practice. In the second mode, the player performs on a theater stage to win a cup. The third mode is a sort of career mode, where the player has to sing in front of judges. The fourth and last mode is a quiz game, presenting the player glimpses of songs, which they have to guess correctly.

sample_screenshots.caption: Type in your name, age and gender.

title: Karaoke Studio

description: Karaoke Studio Senyou Cassette Top Hit 20 Vol. 1 is the first add-on for the Karaoke video game Karaoke Studio, featuring twenty additional songs. It cannot be played without the original cartridge and microphone peripheral. All the game modes themselves remain unchanged.
title: Karaoke Studio Senyou Cassette Top Hit 20 Vol. 1

description:
The story of the game follows Yagyū Jūbei (the historical Yagyū Jūbei Mitsuyoshi was actually one of the most famous samurai in feudal Japan), starting the intro with a baby Jūbei being left to the care of the village where the game begins. From here on out, the plot unfolds in a traditional Japanese RPG manner, involving a coming-of-age story with some world-saving in the mix. The game is divided into ten chapters, each portraying a different character, with all of them eventually coming together towards the end.

Juvei Quest is a Japanese-style role-playing game similar to Dragon Quest series. It follows the usual pattern of walking around villages, having an overworld map and several dungeons to explore, while also featuring a very similar battle system. Stand-out features include the use of maps that lead to hidden treasures, being able to recruit helper characters that can do useful tasks such as deactivating traps, and the ability to essentially purchase extra item slots. Among the more familiar elements are the turn-based battles, lots of different equipment to buy and find, and a vast array of different abilities from all party members (the game uses a skill system, instead of typical magic points for using special abilities).
title: Juvei Quest

description: Karaoke Studio Senyou Cassette Top Hit 20 Vol. 2 is the second add-on for the Karaoke video game Karaoke Studio, featuring twenty additional songs. It cannot be played without the original cartridge and microphone peripheral. All the game modes themselves remain unchanged.
title: Karaoke Studio Senyou Cassette Top Hit 20 Vol. 2

description: Stick Hunter is the first ice hockey game for the NES/Famicom, predating Nintendo's similar Ice Hockey game by a month. The game features a basic set of game options. You can choose between a one or two player game, one of eight countries and the duration of the game. The action is presented from a top-down perspective with the ice rink scrolling horizontally.
title: Stick Hunter: Exciting Ice Hockey

description: SD Gundam World: Gachapon Senshi - Scramble Wars Map Collection is a special version of the original SD Gundam World: Gachapon Senshi - Scramble Wars replacing the original scenarios with ten new scenarios. It could only be obtained via Famicom Disk Writer kiosks. Gameplay and graphics remain unchanged.

sample_screenshots.caption: A scenario that is placed in space.

title: SD Gundam World: Gachapon Senshi - Scramble Wars Map Collection

description:
Mezase! Top Pro: Green ni Kakeru Yume (めざせ！トップ プロ グリーンに賭ける夢) is a golf game which supports several different modes of play:

  • Stroke Play - 1-2 player mode where you aim to earn the best score
  • Match Play - a 2-player competition mode on 18 holes
  • Challenge Mode - a single-player tournament mode aiming to become a top pro, with last barrier being Jaleco cup
  • Training - mode where player can select any course and train without pressure of competing against anyone

Shooting is done using 3rd-person back camera where the power meter bar is displayed and you have to press the button to start and end to swing and hit the ball. The ball camera is then done using top-down perspective showing the entire hole with the side bar displaying your current score, remaining distance to the hole, wind info and the club you're using. Your caddy will occasionally give you advices between your swings. The camera turns entirely top-down when you are on the green, zooming in on the green area thus providing you with more info such as the deformation of the terrain.
title: Mezase! Top Pro: Green ni Kakeru Yume

description: Dirty Pair: Project Eden is a platform action game based on the anime movie of the same name. The game can either be played alone, in which case the player takes control of blue haired Yuri, or in a two-player simultaneous mode in which the second player takes control of red-haired Kei. The game consists of four sections. Section one and three are straightforward auto-scrolling platform stages in which the player has to jump around and shoot incoming enemies. In section two and four the environment and gameplay change to a non-linear room-based maze-layout in which the player has to find disks in order to finish the section. Many rooms are locked and must be unlocked first by using bombs, key cards or other means.
title: Dirty Pair: Project Eden

description:
Super Boy Allan is the second game in Sunsoft's "Intelligence Game" edutainment series for the Famicom Disk System, featuring two different game modes.

The first game mode, which is also the main game, has the player control a boy on his search for a healing herb. The environment looks strikingly similar to the first The Legend of Zelda game. The player has to avoid contact with enemies and push logs in order to solve math-based problems to get extra items. Solving math problems also increases your ability to move several logs at once, which is needed to make further progress.

The second, and much simpler game mode, has the player to finish a 39-steps marathon run by correctly answering simple math questions to accumulate as many points as possible.

sample_screenshots.caption: Well, this is not hard to solve.
Let's run a marathon through the USA.

title: Super Boy Allan

description:
In Risa no Yousei Densetsu the player takes the role of a boy visiting a concert of popular Japanese idol, singer and actress Risa Tachibana. During the concert the sky darkens, lightning strikes and he and Risa get mysteriously transported into a fairy land, which is threatened by an evil witch and her minions. So starts their adventure to overcome the evil witch and find a way back to their own world.

The game is a typical menu-based console adventure game with verbs like "speak", "use", "go" or "take", being the first menu choice, being followed by nouns in subsequent menus.

Through their journey the player and Risa visit a winter town and an enchanted forest. They must help underwater creatures against a vicious medusa and finally enter the castle of the evil witch herself. The game includes many references and characters from classic fairy tales. At some points during the game, a telephone number is shown, which (back in the day) players could use to retrieve information about what to do next.

sample_screenshots.caption: Meeting a girl that sells matches.
Find a way to get the harp from the mayor.

title: Risa no Yōsei Densetsu

description:
In Sanada Jūyūshi the player controls Sanada Yukimura, a famous warlord during the Japanese Sengoku period. Sanada Yukimura gets send out by his father to find ten powerful warriors, which according to a popular Japanese legend would come to be known as the "Sanada Ten Braves" ("Sanada Jūyūshi"), to support him in the war.

The game differs a bit from being a typical "Dragon Quest" clone by featuring a unique combat system. Instead of HP, Sanada Yukimura recruits troops by talking to enemies and persuading them to fight for him by offering the rations and weapons. Once he finds one of the ten special warriors, they join his party and become troop leaders as well. It is important to use the right unit type against enemies, because they all are strong or weak against certain enemy types. A samurai for example is strong against swordsmen, but weak against thieves.

All members of the ten braves have special abilities which are crucial to progress in the game. One character can move boulders and trees, another one allows the party to sail with a ship and yet another one can be send out to retrieve important information, which is needed to trigger certain events to progress in the story and so on.

Most of the time the party will move around the overworld to walk from one town to the next. Townspeople provide information. Towns are also needed to stock up with rations and weapons in shops. They also often feature a gambling house, where there is the possibility to bet money on the outcome of a cast of dice. Dungeons in the form of caves or underground passages are also present, but not as numerous or dominant as in many other Famicom RPGs of that era.

sample_screenshots.caption: Inside one of the few dungeons.

title: Sanada Jūyūshi

description:
Kyūkyoku Harikiri Stadium is the first title in a whole series of baseball games from Taito. Players have the option between a 1-player game against the CPU or a 2-player game. They have the choice to pick a team from a pool of thirteen non-licensed teams. Each team has its own players with slightly different stats. The third and last mode is a special homerun race. The players compete to hit as many homeruns in a given number of tries.

The game itself follows the standard formula of nearly all baseball games of its time, with having a 3rd-person view from behind the batter or pitcher during the pitching/batting scenes and an overhead view of the field once the batter player hits the ball. After a successful 1-player match a password is given with the option to increase some of the player's stats.
title: Kyūkyoku Harikiri Stadium

alternate_titles.title: The Brave Fighter of Sun Fighbird

description:
Taiyō no Yūsha: Fighbird is a vertical scrolling shooter. The game is based on a mecha anime of the same title.

The solar system is under threat by aliens that are being led by Dryas, with the help of a human mad scientist named Dr. Jango. The Space Police Force (SPF) is tasked with seeking out the Evil Energy that constitutes Dryas and destroying the mechabeasts that he deploys to attack the human race whether in Earth or in space.

The player at the start of the game gets to choose between two characters, Kenta, a special member of the SPF and grandson of Dr. Hiroshi Amano, the scientist that develops the mechs of the SPF; or the main character, Yuutarou Katori, the human identity of the space guardian known as Fighbird.

The game has four stages with 3 phases: the first phase starts with the player selecting one of the members of the machine rescue team known as the Baron Team (which the player can swap with any of the vehicles anytime); the second phase starts the player with Fire Jet and performing specific tasks, like destroying or collecting certain objects, and the last phase is where the player plays as Fighbird himself and goes on to fight the stage bosses.

sample_screenshots.caption: Aqua Baron, a jet plane-like submarine

title: Taiyō no Yūsha: Fighbird

description:
In Seiken Psycho Caliber: Majū no Mori Densetsu the player controls an unnamed hero, which legends say will rid the lands from the clutches of evil forces from the Dark World. The gameplay resembles that of the original The Legend of Zelda game. On his quest the player has to travel and fight his way through the game world which consists of nine overland areas and several dungeons. While its possible to go back and visit already explored and finished areas the game is a lot more linear than the aforementioned Zelda game.

The player starts out with only a sword as a weapon. Better sword variants can be found and bought and it can eventually also shoot projectiles at enemies, not unlike Zelda again. Other typical items like health refills, ranged weapons, teleport items and a handful of special items that are needed to progress the story, are also incorporated into the game.

In addition to a normal health bar, which gets reduced when the player comes in contact with enemies, there has to be paid attention to an extra counter that works as a sort of time-limit because it gets lower even when the player doesn't move or does anything at all. When killed, enemies might leave an item behind that increases the counter as well as the chance for a money increase. Money is used to buy stuff from shops which can be found scattered throughout the areas.

sample_screenshots.caption: A bleak landscape. Beware of quicksand.
The game offers three game save slots.

title: Seiken Psycho Caliber: Majū no Mori Densetsu

description:
An F-1 racing title featuring three game modes. The Warming Up mode lets the player practice five laps on one of the sixteen tracks by themselves. Battle mode lets the player compete against another player or a computer controlled driver in a split-screen race (lasting from between one to ten laps depending on the length selected). Players can also watch a race between two computer controlled drivers. Grand Prix mode is the game's career mode. In this series of races, players must first run a fast enough qualifying lap to enter a race. The top four fastest qualifying results are the ones that are chosen to compete. After the four cars finish a race they each receive points depending on what place they finished in. These points keep getting added to the drivers total points tally. Having the most total points after a series of races is the ultimate goal.

There are four F-1 cars that are available to drive. Three have manual transmissions (requires shifting of gears while racing) while one is automatic. They each have individual ratings in power, acceleration, and traction.
title: Nakajima Satoru: F-1 Hero 2

description:
Decathlon is a 1-2 player sports game combining ten athletics track and field events. The game can be played as single events or in a full 10 event competition against the computer or/and a human opponent.

The competing events in the game are the normal: 100m sprint race, 400m dash, 1500m run, 110m hurdles, long jump, high jump, pole vault, shot put, discus throw and javelin throw.

Players can select their country (and the opponents) from eight predefined: UK, France, Germany, Austria, USA, Canada, Japan, Taiwan. The competitors names are not changeable, e.g. 'Tommy' will always compete for the UK.

Only two players (human or computer) compete against each other in every event, so even if in the 1500m run four characters are running on the track; the two extras are just filling out the field, creating a tripping hazard for the two actual competitors.

Each character has a stamina/power that affects his performance, so the player has to keep within the avatars limits, or he gets too tired.

After a single race, the player gets the option of trying again, or ending the event.

In a full decathlon, a points table is filled in as the events progress.

sample_screenshots.caption:
1500m run. The two player characters are blue and orange.
Blue has tired out, and orange is so far back he is shown as an inset.
Stepping over the boundary at the Discus ring.

Single player game - selecting country/character
(always 1vs1 events, even in full competition)

Intermission between days. (5 events on each day.)
It seems I need an ambulance.
Long jump single event results board.

title: Decathlon

description:
In this motocross game, a single player must do battle against the clock, as well as a series of crafty racers, to become the champion of the motocross. The eight tracks that make up the circuit are chock-full of twists, turns, and tricky jumps that all the racers must negotiate. And that's not all: the player must also stay in the running always! You must place in the top two, and then win a race to advance to the next track. Clear all eight tracks, and you might be the toast of the dirt! But one wrong turn, and it's back to training wheels for you.

A practice mode is also available, where the player can practice the tracks before playing them for real.

sample_screenshots.caption: Yeah, let's train a little bit. Selecting course...

title: Motocross Champion

description:
Aliens have taken over Chinaland and have taken the emperor hostage! Fortunately, the emperor's son managed to escape and tell the story of the land's sorry plight to Jack and Ryu, Chinaland's resident ninja masters. Now it's up to them to rescue the emperor and free Chinaland from alien invasion!

Super Chinese 3 is an action RPG for one or two players. In a two-player game, player 1 controls Jack and player 2 controls Ryu. In a one-player game, only Jack will be playable, but Ryu can join in at any time and share Jack's experience level. Both Ninja Boys share experience points so that they remain at the same level.

Jack and Ryu explore the world map in an overhead view. As with the previous Super Chinese game, random encounters with monsters will give them the option to flee or to fight. While in combat (which takes place in a side-scrolling perspective or across multiple rooms), the players can use the control pad to move Jack or Ryu and the button to either punch or do a somersault jump to damage enemies. Additional power-ups can also be found during the course of battles. The combat ends when either side is out of hit points. Successfully defeating enemies awards experience points and Sen money, which can be spent in the convenience store of each town to increase abilities and buy new weapons. Some of these include throwing stars, special martial arts techniques, swords, projectile attacks and other special powers. Towns also contain people who will give clues and information to Jack & Ryu.

When bosses are encountered, the game play changes to a turn-based system. In each turn, commands are given to Jack & Ryu, which include usage of special items and skills acquired during the game, who then perform actions based on those commands. The enemy's turn takes place the same way. Again, the battle ends when either side is out of hit points.

sample_screenshots.caption: Under attack by some cat ninjas

title: Super Chinese 3

description: After Burner II is the second port of After Burner II for NES. Besides the new name, the differences between those two versions are only technical: less flicker, a different color palette and changes in the music.
title: After Burner II

description:
Crime Busters is a light gun game in which the player takes the role of a police officer and has to shoot bandits. The game consists of three stages: the street outside of a bank, a warehouse and the inside of a bank.

The first stage has the criminals appearing either at the windows or at the door of the bank. In stage two the player has to face ninjas who will appear behind obstacles, running from side to side of the screen or hanging from the ceiling; some ninjas will hold hostages that should not be shot. Shooting the lights in the ceiling will make the room darker. Stage three has bank robbers hidden behind obstacles or running from side to side; hostages also appear on this stage.

The player can choose a stage to start from. At first, the player has to shoot 20 enemies to progress to the next stage. Shooting all enemies sends the player to the next level with five more enemies to shoot. When all three stages are beaten, the game continues from the first stage selected. The player starts with 5 lives, which can be lost by taking three shots from the enemies or shooting hostages three times.

sample_screenshots.caption: Enemies will also appear closer to the player.
Now all is dark. Avoid shooting the hostages.
Shooting the lamps will diminish the light in the warehouse.

title: Crime Busters

description:
Hirake! Ponkikki was a long-running Japanese children's program similar to Sesame Street; this game features the show's two main characters, Gachapin the dinosaur and Mukku the yeti, in a little friendly competition. Five mini-games repeat over the course of five islands, and each island must be cleared of all five games before proceeding to the next. The set-up is mainly intended for two players, with one player controlling Gachapin and the other Mukku. In one-player mode, either character may be selected, but the CPU will not compete at any game other than rock-paper-scissors. Players begin with a limited number of lives which may be lost by colliding with enemies or performing poorly at minigames; one extra life is also awarded at the end of each island. However, there is also a password system which allows the game to be resumed from any island.

The minigames are as follows:* Platforming: Collect fruit while avoiding enemies in a slowly auto-scrolling platforming game. Whoever gets the most fruit wins.

  • Shape Matching: Hurry to match the most shapes before time expires.
  • The Shell Game: Pick out the spaceship with the other character in five rounds of the shell game.
  • Rock-Paper-Scissors: Defeat the other character a set number of times at the classic hand game.
  • Maze Chase: Race against the other player to collect the most candy apples before exiting. In later levels, avoid worms as well.

sample_screenshots.caption: Matching shapes.  Don't take too long or get too many wrong, or you'll lose.
Title Screen.  Would we like a one or two player game?
... but I've found him this time.
The title of the first island is "Let's Go Hiking in the Mountains!"
When you finish an island, you get a cute celebration screen.

title: Hirake! Ponkikki

description: The console version of Wit's, while playing very similarly to the arcade version, still has a few slight overall differences. While the arcade version has you progress through 99 levels, the console version has, much like the Mega Man series, a stage select screen where you choose the opponent you're to face off against. Each of the five initial levels consists of five rounds and features a different gameplay gimmick that you'll have to master. In addition to the single player game, the game also features various multiplayer modes for up to four players.
title: Wit's

description:
Director Masanobu Endo's original vision for Mobile Suit Z Gundam: Hot Scramble contained only the first-person shooting segments, but this version performed poorly in playtesting, leading to significant revision for the retail release. This original version of the game was still made available as a contest prize with reportedly only 1,000 physical copies being printed.

Compared to the retail release the paradoxically named Final Version has several changes:

  • Complete absence of all side-scrolling stages. Instead of ending with boarding a space station or battleship stages simply end once all enemies have been destroyed.

  • Only TITANS mecha appear as enemy units. The game also has a different intro to reflect the absence of Neo-Zeon mecha.

  • A more complicated UI that has an enemy radar

  • Enemies on ground maps are more aggressive and attack in greater number, but there are no items on the ground nor do ground maps transition into space maps.
title: Mobile Suit Z Gundam: Hot Scramble (Final Version)

description:
Perkele!: Suomi 100 Vuotta is a collection of three games created in celebration of the 100 year anniversary of Finland's independence from Russia. The games included are:

  • Nakkikioskitappelu (Snack Bar Fight): a 1-on-1 2D fighting game were you try to buy a snack but end up getting into drunken fights after the bar has closed for the night. The game can be played against the AI or against a second player.
  • Saimaannorpan Kosto (Saimaa Ringed Seal's Revenge): a side-scrolling shooter were you control a Saimaa ringed seal that can shoot lazers from its eyes. Your goal is to kill the humans who are polluting Lake Saimaa.
  • Talvisota (Winter War): a shooting gallery like Duck Hunt which requires the NES Zapper. Your goal is to shoot the Russian soldiers that are trying to invade Finland while avoiding friendly troops.
title: Perkele!: Suomi 100 Vuotta

description:
This release contains the following games in a single cartridge:

  • Exerion
  • Formation Z
  • Field Combat
  • City Connection
title: 8-Bit Collection: Jaleco Vol. 1

description:
This release contains three games developed by Culture Brain in a single cartridge:

  • Hiryū no Ken III: Go-nin no Dragon
  • Super Chinese (a.k.a. Kung-Fu Heroes and Chinese Hero)
  • Super Chinese 2: Dragon Kid (a.k.a. Little Ninja Brothers
title: 8-Bit Collection: Culture Brain Vol. 1

description:
This is the final installment of the SD Gundam World series to be released on the Famicom. The objective of the game is to conquer both Earth and space, by leading your army into battle against groups of rival armies.

There are 10 preset scenarios in the game, each with a specified number of teams and a time limit to get the objectives done. (The player can also choose a Free Scenario.) Once a scenario is chosen, and game settings are set (all settings can be changed in Free Scenario mode), the player and computer take turns navigating units through a series of menus, in the hopes of gaining enough force to occupy a locale. Once a locale is captured, the player who took it over gains money which can be used to bolster their units. The first player to capture all 21 areas (or the player further ahead when time is up) wins the scenario.

A battery-backed memory allows players to save their progress and return to the game at a later time.

sample_screenshots.caption: Team stats beforee starting the game

title: SD Gundam World: Gachapon Senshi 5 - Battle of Universal Century

description: Flying Hero is Arkanoid-like arcade game about firefighters. You control the two firemen holding the trampoline at the bottom of the screen, moving them left and right to catch the Flying Hero and launch him back up to rescue more citizens and put out more fires on building.
title: Flying Hero

description:
Karakuri Kengōden: Musashi Lord - Karakuribito Hashiru! is an RPG based on Karakuri Kengō Den Musashi Lord, a 1990/91 50 episodes anime. It takes place in a medieval Japanese setting where humans and human-like robots live together.

In the anime Musashi, the main (robot) character venture to become top martial artist. The game is a classic bird's-eye view Zelda-style action game, but with many RPG elements and level-up progression. It is divided in four chapters (+a bonus one) with different main characters, and you may choose at the beginning which one to play. It is one of the first games to have multiple scenarios with different characters that converge into a single story.
title: Karakuri Kengōden: Musashi Lord - Karakuribito Hashiru!

description:
In this 3D dungeon RPG that plays in the classic Wizardry style, you play as a three character party and you may choose from different classes at the beginning of the game, each with different stats and growth progression. During battles, enemies are positioned on top and allies on the bottom of the screen. When you choose to attack, the characters impact physically with each other and there is small animations when magic is used. Maximum of three enemies are displayable, two small ones and a medium sized one.

The game is a pioneer in the "RPG tool creation" genre, like RPG Maker. There is an edit mode that allows you to edit some aspects of the game. For example you may choose a soundtrack (such as sci-fi or fantasy), or even create your own dungeons (max 8 of them) with enemies and treasure chests. In this edit mode you can also edit items stats, characters' aesthetics (just slight modifications from predefined sets), and stats of enemies. You may even change messages displayed in town shops and what's displayed during the opening and the ending.

sample_screenshots.caption: Need a place to sleep, baby.

title: Dungeon Kid

description: SWAT: Special Weapons and Tactics is a tactical turn-based RPG in which you traverse a pseudo-3D building to search for and fight terrorists. You can choose to interrogate or kill the terrorists at the end of the fights.
title: SWAT: Special Weapons and Tactics

description: Marusa no Onna is an adventure game based on the 1987 film of the same name (which was released in English as A Taxing Woman). Following the film's plot, players control a tax auditor named Ryōko Itakura who travels the city to uncover tax evasion and fraud. The action plays mostly like a visual novel and done by selecting various actions from the on-screen menu. The main exception is an overhead exploration mode where players can move through the streets in order to enter buildings. Players can also receive a password from their home office in order to save their progress.
title: Marusa no Onna

description: Samurai Sword is a fantasy adventure game for the Famicom Disk System. The game begins with the hero (named by the player) being defeated in battle by the dark priest Soron. The hero must advance through different landscapes searching for the Samurai Sword, the only weapon strong enough to destroy Soron. Along the way you are accompanied by Saria, a light mage with access to various spells. The game controls like a Japanese-style adventure game with all actions selected from a text menu. Apart from the normal puzzle-solving gameplay, there are occasionally battles against monsters. These are also solved and won through menu commands, often times requiring the help of Saria's magic. The game is divided into multiple sections, between which players can save their progress.
title: Samurai Sword

description: Cocoron is a platformer released exclusively for the Famicom. The game lets the player create customisable characters to play the game with. Each created character has their own strengths and weaknesses depending on the components chosen. Levels can be played in any order and consist of entrance and exit sections. After getting through the entrance section the players has to beat the level boss and then has to go through the exit section to finish the stage.
title: Cocoron

description:
Millionaire is a version of the popular board game Monopoly. The rules are pretty similar to the original, but the places in the board are the most noticeable difference. Instead of pieces of land with street names, the board features country names, such as Spain, Turkey or Switzerland. After buying such places, players can build houses or hotels.

Another place called Wine Plant works the same as countries. There is a Forbidden Zone that sends players that land upon it to the Jail. Once in the jail, the player stays there for 3 turns (or before with a free from jail pass). In the Bank, shares can be bought and have their values increased or decreased and later be sold. In the Casino, a game of cups and balls can be played. In "!" and "?" places, players chose among three cards facing down, each card with a different effect, such as increase in stocks values, free from jail passes, or even fire that destroys all buildings. Finally, there is also an Insurance place, where players can buy insurance for their buildings.

Up to four players can take turns in this game. Each one starts with 7.500 dollars, and leaves the board when there's no money left to pay the bills. The last player standing wins.

sample_screenshots.caption: Buying shares in the stock market.
The outcome of a "?" event card.
A player lands on the forbidden zone and goes to jail.
I'm about to roll the 12 sided dice.

title: Millionaire

description:
Jovial Race is an action game similar to Pac-Man. Players control a racing car through a maze, running from other cars and collecting flags scattered around. The aim is to collect all flags in a particular maze to proceed to the next one of the 75 available.

There is a radar in the lower portion of the screen where players can see where the enemy cars and the flags are. The enemy cars are faster than the player, so it is necessary to try to lose them. If that doesn't work, players can leave smoke trails behind that will stop the enemy cars. These trails take fuel away; the car can be refueled by taking the flag with a L beside it.

Players can also collect food items which will earn them money. Running over animals make the players lose money. This money can be used to buy upgrades in a shop, accessible by pressing Start. The upgrades available are Turbo (speed boost), Gun (shoots enemy cars and stuns them), Saver (slows fuel consumption), Wheel (makes the car turn faster), Bumper (allows running over some obstacles), Secret (turns the car into a ghost, allowing for running through enemies), Rocket (shoots enemies and destroys them) and 1-Ups.

sample_screenshots.caption: The flag with an L refuels your car.
Leaving a smoke trail to stop the enemy cars.

title: Jovial Race

description:
The Holy Diver (Collector's Edition) is a limited edition published and distributed by Retro-Bit, compatible with all classic NES consoles and Retro-Bit consoles:

  • Outer collectible hard embossed cardboard box.
  • Inner collectible retail version box.
  • The game Holy Diver with authentic dust cover. First 1,000 units come with a special limited edition white colored cartridge.
  • Full color instruction manual.
  • Hard cover notebook.
  • Individually numbered certificate of authenticity.
  • Limited edition enamel pin set.
  • Original art prints.
  • Exclusive collection of stickers.
title: Holy Diver (Collector's Edition)

description: The 30th Anniversary Classic Cartridge Edition of Mega Man 2 published by iam8bit is the original game on a brand-new playable NES cartridge in a tri-fold box w/ foil, gloss and embossments. Limited to a total of 8500 copies, of which 7500 copies come in Opaque Light Blue and 1000 copies come in Translucent, Glow-in-the-Dark Blue. The original manual has been worked over and includes mini posters. The tri-fold packaging doubles as a mini poster when opened up.
title: Mega Man 2 (30th Anniversary Classic Cartridge)

description:
Relics: Ankoku Yōsai is a sequel to Relics which, compared to the predecessor, simplifies the gameplay and has only one ending. This game opts for a more Metroid-inspired style and even adds a tune constantly looping while playing the game.

The player takes role of a being that's sacrificed its body in order to take control of the bodies of the deceased Holy Warriors of Light, the only ones capable to defeat the forces of hell. The goal is to rescue the princess of heaven, imprisoned in the fortress of hell and the only way to get to her is by collecting 5 idols.

The Family Computer Disk System version of Relics changes the story and limits the way the body swapping mechanic works by making the player collect amulets and fight specific bosses to switch bodies. Players can also cause damage to the walls which could reveal secret areas containing keys, health restoring items and power-ups.

While looking very impressive for a Family Computer Disk System game, due to the hardware limitations, the game suffers from frequent loading of the areas and the enemies in an area. The collision detection can be inaccurate and it will be necessary to swap the sides of the Disk Card every time the main character dies and even during some of the levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: Defeating the fighter grants us the next playable character with an even shorter range attack than the first character.
The sorcerer has a long-range attack so he will make the game so much easier till you get the next character.
You start the game and immediately meet a bouncer.

title: Relics: Ankoku Yōsai

description:
Based on the anime series, this is an action/rpg developed by Westone who also developed the Monster World series. The battle scenes in particular will be instantly recognisable to Monster World fans as they have very similar art and gameplay styles.

In this game you travel the world trying to save Wataru from the evil antagonist Darkdar. The main overworld display is the standard top down view of most JRPG's, complete with random battles. Once you engage your enemy the perspective switches to a side view where you pilot your mech and battle against monsters. It's fast and fluid and all played out in real time, with jump and attack mapped to your A & B buttons.

sample_screenshots.caption: This woman also tells us how much XP we need for the next level.

title: Mashin Eiyūden Wataru Gaiden

description: Blade Buster is a homebrew game for NES. It is a score attack, top-down shoot 'em up game with two game modes: two and five minutes, each ending with a boss battle.
title: Blade Buster

description:
The Earth is being invaded from space by the Epsilon Empire and have already landed. To thwart the invasion, a humanoid robot is sent out to blast the aliens away.

Cosmic Epsilon is a 3D forward moving shooter. It uses the Famicom 3D System to give it 3D effects. Players alternate levels with their robot character in either flight mode or in humanoid mode. There are a variety of settings for each level.

Gameplay is similar for both types of levels however. Players move all around the screen area and can attack the enemies coming from the background into the foreground. The player can shoot them with homing missiles or with the default Vulcan beam. The Vulcan Beam can be charged up for extra damage. Powerups can be collected from defeated enemies.
title: Cosmic Epsilon

description: RoboCop 3 for the NES is a platform shooter game starring the eponymous metal cyborg. This version is in many aspects similar to the version for 8-bit computers also developed by Probe Software: these games share level aesthetics and designs and musical score. However, the NES version is quite different: there's no first-person shooting level; instead, the first level is an exclusive side-scrolling stage. All levels feature slightly different designs, all bosses are redesigned as well, including the tank boss and final boss battle, in which Robocop has to do something entirely different than destroy the ninjas.

sample_screenshots.caption: Cleared the area... might as well enjoy the scenery...
Those hanging enemies are particularly annoying
In level 3, Robocop gets a jetpack

title: RoboCop 3

alternate_titles.title: Miss Peach World 1: Super L.A. Cop

description: This reskinned version of Menace Beach makes several changes to the original game. It replaces the original male protagonist with a female skateboarder; adds new background music between levels; and replaces the original after-stage artwork with nude anime drawings.
title: Miss. Peach World: L.A Cop

description:
Bowser and his minions have traveled through time and have stolen historical artifacts to add to Bowser's museum. While Yoshi was checking out this museum, he was captured by Bowser. Now it's up to Mario to rescue Yoshi and return the stolen objects back to their rightful place.

The game consists of Mario defeating enemies in a Mario Bros style game. Once all the enemies are defeated, they drop a stolen item which Mario needs to pick up. Mario then enters into a Timulator (a time traveling machine) and warps to the player's selected time period. The selected time period is basically a small side-scrolling area where Mario has to find the correct location to drop the current item he is holding. If Mario drops the item in the wrong location or the wrong time period, it will be taken away and Mario will have to restart the item collection process all over again. This side-scrolling section also holds the educational aspect of the game as Mario can jump into message blocks and learn factoids about the time and location he is currently in.

The game will have Mario returning fourteen items (one for each time period) before he will be made to take a history exam about the knowledge he has gained from all this item gathering. Once that's finished Mario will finally be able to confront Bowser and rescue Yoshi.

sample_screenshots.caption: Hitting blocks gives you information about the current period.
Landmarks may not be to exact scale.
Play the arcade classic to access the different ages.

title: Mario's Time Machine

description: Tetsudō-ō is a railroad themed board game. Players take turns moving along the board, made up of railroad track, landing on spaces which trigger events and give the player money. Money can be used to buy and improve train stations and other options. Players pay rent when landing on the station of another player.
title: Tetsudō-ō

description:
A compilation of the following four games on one cartridge:

  • Double Strike
  • Little Red Hood
  • Metal Fighter
  • Pipemania
title: Funblaster Pak

description:
Super Pinball as the name suggests is a video game version of pinball. At the beginning of the game the player is given an incomplete mahjong hand with one missing tile. They are then shown the tile that will complete their hand and locating that tile is the goal of the pinball game. When the tile is found the game ends immediately. The players now completed hand will determine their final score as their score from pinball will be multiplied by the strength of their hand.

As in a typical pinball game, players shoot the pinball into play and then take control of a pair of flippers trying to keep the ball in play. The pinball table itself is car-themed, for example the table has the letters C-A-R and also has a gas stand slot machine. The table is made up of six screens with some parts accessible by getting the ball into a certain location. Some of the screens have their own goals to rack up points such as destroying UFO's with the pinball.

Players start with three pinballs and can earn more pinballs with high scoring play. The game can also end when the player loses all of their pinballs.

sample_screenshots.caption: The lower portion of the table.
The middle portion of the table.
The main menu and title screen.

title: Super Pinball

description:
One evening as Jajamaru and Sakurahime where watching a rare meteor storm, they witnessed a UFO crash land just beyond a nearby mountain. Inside the vessel they discovered the Great Galactic King. The king claimed the evil Don Destroida had just transformed his precious star into a mechanical planet filled with fearful robots. Our heroes than decide it is up to them to save the universe from Don Destroida and his robot horde. Jajamaru and Sakurahime are granted hammers by the Great Galactic King before taking off into space with the king's ship.

In this Ninja Jajamaru-kun game, users can play either as Jajamaru or Sakurahime. Ninja Jajamaru: Ginga Daisakusen is somewhat of a departure from previous 8-bit entries in that it draws some design elements from other contemporary platformers creating a different feel when compared to older games. Character sprites are bigger and more cartoonish. Players jump on top of enemies to defeat them. A myriad of powerups can be found inside of blocks scattered across each level. A new status bar on the bottom of the screen displays various information such has remaining lives, currently active powerups, etc. In certain levels, pipes can be used to access sub-areas.

Aside from general platforming gameplay Ninja Jajamaru: Ginga Daisakusen has a somewhat unique multi-staged running mechanic dubbed the "reservoir dash." While standing still users can hold the B button to build up power. This power can then be released to run at high speed. It also allows the player to jump higher and further than normal. This is often required to make it across large gaps, or get over tall obstructions. At at full charge the character will begin somersaulting. This allows the player slice throw enemies while airborne, make jumping through hectic areas a bit easier. If the player sits and charges the reservoir dash to long the character becomes exhausted and temporarily can't move, leaving them exposed to attack. The rate at which charge is built varies between the two playable characters. Jajamaru can built up dash faster, while Sakurahime can higher jump power while dashing.

sample_screenshots.caption: Player can climb up certain surfaces.
One powerup allows the player to temporarily transform into a robotic frog. It can only move by leaping.
Fully charge dash allows player to somersault through the air.
Breaking blocks often reveals hidden items.

title: Ninja Jajamaru: Ginga Daisakusen

description:
This cartridge contains five classic Data East games for the NES:* Bad Dudes

  • Buggy Popper (Bump 'N' Jump)
  • BurgerTime
  • Ring King
  • Side Pocket

This set also includes a set of five stickers and two buttons.
title: Data East All Star Collection

description: Thunderbolt 2 is a vertically-scrolling top-down shooter set in space. The introduction shows how Earth is attacked from outer space. The player controls a space ship through three levels, each one with a boss. The ship can be freely moved around the screen and it has an unlimited amount of bullets. The ship has three lives but additional ones can be earned by destroying enemies. Destroyed opponents leave behind power-ups that provide weapon upgrades with new bullets patterns as well as bomb icons that clear the entire screen right away when they are picked up. Enemies typically appear in waves with different patterns.
title: Thunderbolt 2

description:
Jet-Paco is a NES conversion of the ZX Spectrum game of the same name only available as part of the 2013 release Mojon Twins Covertape #2. The player controls the astronaut Paco Rebollez. He is in charge of harvesting and collecting energonia crystals, a resource used to power space ships. The game consists of two missions, selectable from the title screen, where he has to collect 20 crystals.

The missions consist of several single-screen rooms connected vertically and horizontally so there is free exploration to collect the crystals in any order. He can fly around with an unlimited amount of fuel using a jet pack. Movement is based on thrust, so the player can either keep a button pressed to keep rising or use small taps to hover and navigate small passages. He can fly through platforms but will land on them when landing from above. There are hazard and enemies in irregular patterns to avoid. Paco has no means to attack, the focus is on careful navigation using the jet pack mechanic. He starts with ten lives and no additional ones can be earned. The HUD shows how many crystals are left to be found.

Next to the free download release there was an exclusive crowdfunded release with the game on a NTSC/PAL cartridge. Based on the tier different extras were provided such as having your name listed in the game's credits, a full box and manual instead of just the cartridge, a full box and manual with the cartridge and signed by the authors, a surprise NES homebrew cartridge with a game from another developer, physical versions of the ZX Spectrum games Uwol: Quest for Money or Goku Mal, become the protagonist in the game with a modified game sprite, a Mojon Twins T-shirt or access to the NES mold used for the cartridge.

sample_screenshots.caption: Main menu with the mission selection

title: Jet-Paco

description:
Mojonian Tales is an anthology of more than 20 games created by the Spanish group Mojon Twins brought together on a single NES cartridge. It contains a mix of older games that were previously available and are now refurbished or reprogrammed, NES ports of existing games for other platforms and entirely new games that were previously never available. There is a broad mix of genres such as action games, platformers, shooters and puzzle titles. Next to what is available right away there are also several hidden treasures and easter eggs even leading to complete games that are not advertised. The hidden games are accessed by entering code through an option in the main menu and the codes are revealed in several ways.

The release is only available on a cartridge and through a mail order, either as a loose cartridge or in a bitbox case with a full cover. It also includes a colour manual. The cartridge comes in three colours: grey, red and green, with the latter limited to 100 copies. It is compatible with both NTSC and PAL.

Some of the included games are: Cheril... in the Cave*

  • Cheril Begins
  • Cheril of the Bosque
  • Cheril in Another Bosque
  • Cheril the Nine
  • Dark Yun
  • Dire Job! (Trabajo Basura)
  • Espinete's Big Trouble
  • An Incredible Customizer (used to find some hidden games)
  • Jet Puri Begins
  • Jet Puri II
  • Journey to the Centre of the Alien
  • Mega Meghan
  • Monoma Ninona Pana
  • The Rendezvous
  • Sgt. Helmet's Commandow
  • Sgt. Helmet: Training Day (version R)
  • Sonic Bad
  • Yun (v3.5)
  • Zombie Calavera: Prologue

sample_screenshots.caption: Start of the first level (demo version)

title: Mojonian Tales

description:
Lala the Magical is a 2D side-scrolling platformer based on the 2010 title Lala: Prologue by the same developer. It was originally created for the 2016 NESdev Competition. While the very early parts still have some resemblance to the original game, the majority of the content and the gameplay mechanics, as well as the story with its multiple stages and cut-scenes, is entirely new and very different.

Lala is a magic apprentice in the province of Badajoz where she lives with her teacher. She is a little bored and when her teacher is away for a few days, she decides to try an enter the Sky Palace. It is a dangerous place her teacher has warned her about, but she wants to try to enter it and collect the three power gems that are hidden there. First Lala needs to locate her teacher's magic wand. This is done in the first stage which is the closest to the original game. Lala can move around freely, but has no means to attack. She has to complete platforming sections and avoid enemies to collect eight potions to become stronger and locate a key that opens the teacher's locked dungeon. Horizontally the screen scrolls but vertically the game uses the fixed-screen flip system of the original game to connect rooms. She starts with three lives and a single collision with an enemy or a hazard such as spikes removes one. Every now and then she can find a heart-shaped lollipop that restores a life.

Once the wand is discovered Lala can start the second stage with new gameplay mechanics to reach the Sky Palace. She can swing her wand and another ability allows her to create a temporary platform in the air, but only one at a time. This mechanic is often used to cross large gaps. Lala can also use it quickly in succession to climb anywhere. Stage three is about locating the three power gems. Each room in the palace has a door that is opened with a switch and there is time pressure. When the sun sets, visible through changes in the sky background, everything will get darker until it is pitch black. Eventually the palace disappears complete. Doors you have opened remain open so you can progress faster for a new run.

In the last stage Lala needs to collect coins and when all of them are collected an invincible ghost is released, chasing her relentlessly across the entire level. Waving Lala's wand is needed to scare the ghosts away. There are cut-scenes that further the story between levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: Using the wand to create temporary platforms.
You need a key to unlock the gate.
Timing to get the potion in the top right corner.

title: Lala the Magical

description:
Wǒ xiang niào niào is a deliberately difficult 2D side-scrolling platform game created for the 2016 NESdev comptition. It consists of four main levels with two parts each. In each level the girl Lin Lin needs to navigate difficult platform sections while collecting flies. She needs the flies to please the Frog King so he gets out of the way and Lin Lin gets to use the toilet, which ends the level. If Lin Lin has collected at least eight flies when she reaches the king, she gets to play a bonus level where any flies she collects are carried over to the second part of the level. The second part is more difficult each time because it is auto-scrolling and Lin Lin needs to advance quickly. Each level has a different theme introducing new challenges such as bouncing blocks for instance.

Lin Lin has no means to attack. Next to the jumping the only action she can perform is a butt stomp which launches her off an enemy. This technique with careful timing is most often used to cross large gaps, used as a double jump technique. She starts with three lives and when a life is lost the entire level is restarted until she picks up a piece of poo which acts as a checkpoint. A life is lost right away when falling down a gap, but when she touches an enemy she only loses her clothes and can continue. A second hit is then fatal unless she finds an item that brings back her clothes.

sample_screenshots.caption: Here is a piece of poo that acts as a checkpoint.
Start of the first part of the first level
Lin Lin already lost her clothes. To the right there is a bee she can collect.
The white outline provides some guidance as to where you should aim your jump to perform the butt stomp.

title: Wǒ xiang niào niào

description:
Chitei Tairiku Orudoora features two educational math games.

The first game is a side-scrolling platformer. Players control a boy who explores the underground cave system of Orudoora. The boy can jump, duck, and throw bombs to dispose of enemies. The game consists of 31 areas. In the first 10 areas players have to locate an inner tube, an oar, and an onigiri. Finding them will allow the player to advance further into the game. In the next 10 areas players will have to find the items again in order to advance in the game. Then once again for the third and final time, players will have to find the items again in order to move on and face the final boss. In order to exit an area players have to hit a Goblin enemy who will initiate a math problem. Players have to answer three of these math problems correctly to be allowed to leave an area.

The second game is called Step Drill in which players race a motorcycle through Europe. To get a good time, players have to answer 39 math problems in total as fast as they can.
title: Chitei Tairiku Orudoora

description:
Yun is a 2D platform game starring the eponymous character. She is a demon who, in a rare occurrence, hatched out of an egg of the rare Romani Heron in the boggy marsh near of the shores of Lake Potoña in the Province of Badajoz. As a newborn and in the dark as she was born at dusk, she ate the first things she found in her surroundings, which happened to include a tube of toothpaste carelessly thrown away. This provided her with the ability to blow bubbles from her mouth, which she developed to capture animals inside. Just a few months later she founded her own Japanese restaurant near the marsh. One night she was about to capture a big and shiny orange fugu fish, but falls in love with it. Unfortunately the fish knew about her profession and escaped. A dejected Yun decides to change her ways: instead of serving raw fish to customers, she will serve customers to raw fish.

The game contains three levels that consist of single-screen rooms connected both horizontally and vertically using the flip-screen mechanic offering freedom to explore in any direction. To complete a level Yun needs to capture all creatures she can find to fill her restaurant's pantry. The three environments are the marsh woods, an abandoned factory and finally a desert. Yun can blow up to three bubbles one after another. After they are launched they rise automatically, either disappearing from the screen or hovering below an obstacle until they disappear. Yun can use her own bubbles as a platform to reach higher places. The creatures need to be captured that way as well: once trapped Yun can simply touch them to make them disappear. The game shows how many creatures are left to be found.

Yun has a limited amount of lives and any collision with a creature, a hazard such as spikes, or an invincible ghost that chases her around the screen, costs a life. Extra lives are provided through giant red hearts. Certain passages are locked and first require a key to progress. Once all creatures has been captured the level ends right away. A lot of sections require careful platforming.

The game was started as a NES port of Cheril Perils, but was turned into a separate game during development.

sample_screenshots.caption: A short instruction before starting the game
Here is a heart for an extra life.
Yun uses one of her own bubbles to rise to the top of the screen.
A monkey appears from the background to attack Yun.

title: Yun

description:
Mojon Twins Gran Sabiduría: 31 in 1 Real Games is a collection of 31 games, prototypes and demos based on new and existing projects by the Spanish group Mojon Twins, designed after an Asian pirate cartridge. Many of the games are entirely new, but for the ones based on existing projects it is the first time they are available in NES format as almost all of them were previously made for the ZX Spectrum. Some of the titles available in the menu only reveal their real title when you start playing them. Some games are also reskins or variants of other included titles, with a new twist on the gameplay, mechanics or visuals.

The included titles are:

  • Aliens
  • Los amores de Brunilda (Cheril of the Bosque en otro Bosque variant)
  • Baboon!
  • Cheril Begins
  • Cheril the Nine
  • Encuera Women in the Azoteaw!
  • Encuera Women in the Desiertow!
  • Encuera Women in the Pantanow!
  • Espinette (Sonic Mal)
  • Espinete conoce a Ana (Sonic Mal)
  • Espinete Strikes Back (Sonic Mal)
  • I.O.T.Z.M. (Zombie Calavera: Prologue variant)
  • Jet Puri
  • Journey to the Centre of the Nose (demo - Viaje al centro de la napia variant)
  • Lala's P*P*P*P
  • Lala Lah
  • The Legend of Zelda III (Cheril of the Bosque variant)
  • Mega Meghan
  • Memory Somari
  • Monona Ninona Pana
  • Ninjajar: The Prologue
  • Ninjajar You Are Drunk!
  • Poti Poti Grufas
  • The Rendezvous
  • Sgt. Helmet's Commandow!
  • Somari Katamari
  • Sonic the Hedgehog (Sonic Mal)
  • Sonic 2 (Sonic Mal)
  • Sonic 3 of the Bosque (Sonic Mal)
  • Trabajo Basura (Dire Job)
  • Vesta Vaal (prototype)

All games can be selected from the main menu right away. There is also an item called An Incredible Customizer that allows players to directly hack into the ROM changing values, leading to new and unexpected (and most often unplayable) variants of the included games.

sample_screenshots.caption: Cheril of the Bosque en otro Bosque: you meet Lala.
Sonic Mal: jump on top of the creature to kill it.

title: Mojon Twins Gran Sabiduría: 31 in 1 Real Games

description: Super Mario World is an unofficial port of SNES version of the game for NES/Famicom. The gameplay mechanics are similar to the SNES version. You play as Mario or Luigi, your mission is reach the end of the level without any dying.
title: Super Mario World

description:
Cheril the Writer is a game in the long-running series starring the eponymous character as the protagonist. This time Cheril heads to Pepinoni to spend her holidays and where she intends to start work on a book about retro video games. She has a meeting with her editor Amador who will supply the content of the book so she just need to copy and paste it. But when she arrives in Pepinoni everything is a mess. It is overrun by zombies so she has to clear the streets once again.

This 2D platform game consists of several stages. They consist of multiple single-screen rooms connected both horizontally and vertically using the flip-screen mechanic, offering freedom to explore in any direction. There are several platforming sections to complete while avoiding enemies and hazards such as spikes. She has five lives and additional ones are provided by picking up hearts. Cheril has two types of jumps: a short one and a high one, depending on how long the button is held. To complete a level she needs to restore a temple by putting objects back in their original position similar to the mechanic previously used in Cheril the Goddess. She encounters several objects that need to be carried to another location. But she can only carry one object at a time.

Cheril initially has no means to attack, but a game mechanic previously explored in Mega Cheril Perils is revisited. Certain rooms contain a green device she can activate. The screen turns grey and a countdown from ten is started. During that period all enemies are frozen and Cheril can jump on top of them to take them out permanently. The effect is not limited to the room where the device is activated and it can be activated again. True to the series' legacy certain sections are guarded by an old man. Instead of a key Cheril needs to locate and bring him a piece of lingerie so he will let her pass.

sample_screenshots.caption: Uncharacteristically for the developer the first level is a  tutorial.
A difficult section with moving platforms
Cheril grabbed an item, as the fork does not belong on this shrine.

title: Cheril the Writer

description:
Bootèe is a 2D platform game starring Cheril as the protagonist, a recurring character in many of the developer's games. One day Cheril hears about the three legendary stars of power. She grows curious and wants to find out more, when a strange man appears behind a huge pot. He tells her she needs help to reach the stars, but with a proper vehicle. The next thing she knows Cheril finds herself enclosed in a huge boot that leaps by itself. Before she has the chance to ask what to do next, it leaps away.

The game consists of several stages. Each stage is composed of several single-screen rooms connected both horizontally and vertically using the flip-screen mechanic, offering an amount of freedom to explore. To complete a stage Cheril needs to collect twenty coins scattered around the level. They can only be collected completing difficult platforming sections. The boot jumps by itself, so the player only steers left and right. The height of the jump can be made shorter however by pressing down.

Cheril can attack enemies by charging and releasing spit. This does not kill them, but pushes them away slightly. Enemies can be used as platforms by landing on top of them and this will alter their movement pattern. That way both techniques can be used to improvise with the level lay-out, getting enemies out of the way or in a favourable position. There are spikes to avoid and enemies cannot be touched from the side or below, or she loses a life. Cheril starts with five lives and additional ones are earned by picking up red hearts. Certain sections are locked and first require a key to be found.

sample_screenshots.caption: A tricky section to get a key.
A coin and a moving platform
Stay under a low platform to time your move forward.
A short story sequence to introduce the game

title: Bootèe

description:
A witch named Cocona lives in a forest kingdom among animals. From her house inside a carved out hole in a tree trunk, she dreams of becoming a princess. However she needs a jewel to help her achieve her dream. So now it's up to the player to help her fulfill her dreams.

In Cocona World, players take control of a witch named Cocona. The game revolves around maintaining three different meters for Cocona. A magic meter that drains when she attacks with her magic wand and can be refilled by locating a fairy. A mood meter which can be filled by completing Cocona's requests (play bingo, swim in the hot springs, fish, etc...) in a timely manner. Her mood will drain if her requests are ignored or if she is made to attack non-hostile animals. A strength meter which slowly drains naturally over time and can get drained from getting attacked by a hostile animal. It can get refilled by eating, sleeping, and using the hot springs. If either her mood or strength meter are totally empty the game will end.

The game has a clock which tells what time of the day it is. Besides having to do Cocona's requests within a time limit, players have to be wary of the time since certain items can disappear over time and Cocona can only go to sleep at her house after a certain time which will bring her to the next day in game. For every day that passes, Cocona's meters can be filled to a higher level to a maximum of ten points which can be achieved on the sixth day.

The game also has shops where Cocona can spend her treasure she found at a treasure cave or received from defeated animals. Shops carry food and other items to buy.
title: Cocona World

description:
Espitene is a 2D platformer inspired by the 2D Sonic the Hedgehog games created for the 2018 NESdev competition. As a fangame it uses many familiar elements in both visuals and mechanics. Some of the levels were previously featured in Mojon Twins Gran Sabiduría: 31 in 1 Real Games for the six games based on Sonic as the parodies Sonic Mal and the variants with a female character Espinette. This release is much more fleshed out compared to the shorter versions released previously. It contains twelve full stages divided over different zones as well as six boss stages.

The story frames the game as part of the Cheril series. The recurring character in many of the developer's games find a mysterious puppet. When she examines it she knows she has a mission. She dresses up as the puppet wearing it as a costume and that way she becomes Espinette who needs to defeat the evil Somari (a spoof of Mario from Somari the Adventurer, replacing Robotnik as the boss) and finds the six emeralds of Podewwwr.

The player guides Espinette through levels with platform elements. The environment consists of single-screen rooms usually connected horizontally, but sometimes also vertically, using the flip-screen mechanic, offering an amount of freedom to explore. Typical challenges include crossing gaps, avoiding spikes, defeating enemies by jumping into them while spinning, using launchers, moving platforms, disappearing platforms and so on. Espinette can collect rings and when she is hit a single ring remains. When it is picked up again quickly Espinette regains protection against another hit. This can be repeated indefinitely. Sometimes additional lives can be found as well. The height of the jump depends on how long the button is pressed. When jumping in a regular way, without spinning, Espinette is vulnerable and cannot take out enemies, just like Sonic.

sample_screenshots.caption: First level complete by touching the sign.
First act of the Fridge Zone

title: Espitene

description:
MiedoW is an action puzzle game created for the 2017 NESdev competition and starring the developer's recurring character Cheril. She walks into a shrine and falls asleep there. In her dreams a voice commands her to find the daughters belonging to the voice. The game consists of several dreams or levels. In each dream one or two daughters (called 'maids' in the level) need to be located and freed to end the level. Cheril moves through several single-screen rooms connected using the flip-screen mechanic. She can move around, shoot with an unlimited amount of bullets and push certain objects.

Sometimes it is sufficient to get rid of enemies such as skeletons that appear from a spawning points or ghosts that can move through walls to reach the daughters. More often solving environment based puzzles is required. Certain rooms have one or many statues that need to be pushed to their pedestals. Once all of them are in position a passage usually opens to a next room. The room lay-out with many obstacles can be challenging and a wrong move often has Cheril stuck unable to solve the puzzle. She then has to leave the screen in order to reset all the statues and start over.

Some rooms lead to multiple paths, to first find a key to open a gate or to locate more daughters. Each dream introduces new challenges, puzzle elements and hazards. One dream for instance has orbs that need to be shot to light and activate them. Some rooms have gaps, spikes or slippery tiles. Jumping can be used to cross gaps or to pass some hazards. An encounter with an enemy or a hazard immediately removes a life and finding a new life only happens every now and then.

sample_screenshots.caption: The second dream introduces a new enemy.
Move the statue to the pedestal to open up the passage.
Skeletons keep spawning from the skulls until you destroy them.
Here you need to jump over the obstacle.

title: MiedoW

description:
Cheril the Goddess is a 2D platformer made for the 2016 NESdev competition starring the developer's recurring character Cheril. In this title Cheril can become a goddess if she manages to obtain the Skull of Podewwwr. To reach it she must open three gates and unlock a magic column.

It shares its name with the 2012 ZX Spectrum title and borrows a core element that Cheril must collect three items and bring them to the correct pedestal based on the Rock, Paper, Scissors principle. She can carry only one item at a time, so if she hunts down the Stone she must takes it to the Scissors shrine to open the first gate. The game consists of a single, large level where the environment consists of 2D horizontally scrolling rooms combined with the flip-screen mechanic for vertical movement. There is a large amount of freedom to explore freely and to complete the tasks in any order. The Select key is used to bring up a level map where all important locations are shown. After unlocking the three gates a key needs to be found as well to get past the magic column. The map is updated based on progress.

The game uses another game mechanic not part of the 2012 title, but previously featured in the prototype Vesta Vaal part of Mojon Twins Gran Sabiduría: 31 in 1 Real Games. Cheril has access to a shape-shifting feature that allows her to transform into a flying, invincible creature for a short time. That way platform sections can be navigated quickly.
