When in regular form Cheril can only jump and has no means to attack. That means she can only avoid enemies (and some will chase her) and there are hazards to avoid as well. Cheril has three charges to briefly turn into the other form and then she needs to locate a pedestal with two hearts engraved to recharge. These charges can also be used to activate teleporters on different parts of the map.

Cheril starts with five lives and every collision with an enemy or a hazard makes her lose a life. Every now and then a heart can be picked up for an extra life. When dead you lose the item you are carrying, but otherwise progress is saved, so if one gate is already open the game picks up from that point.

sample_screenshots.caption: Caught by an enemy: life lost!
There is a charging pedestal to the right, but you can only reach it from the other side.
The screen turns red as Cheril uses the teleporter.
The first room of the game. Here is Cheril in her regular form next to a pedestal where she can recharge.

title: Cheril the Goddess

description:
Kinnikuman: Kinnikusei Oui Soudatsusen is set during the Scramble for the Throne timeline of the Kinnikuman manga where Kinnikuman is being thwarted from taking the throne.

The game consists of four stages, Stages one, two, and four are side-scrolling action games made up of four sections. At the end of each section is a boss fight. After all the sections of a stage are complete a one-on-one wrestling match then takes place. The third stage consists of a wrestling match only.

During these stages, players can switch between five fighters; Robin Mask, The Teriman, Ramen Man, Wars Man, and Neptune Man. The fighters can take multiple hits, with each hit draining their energy bar. The fighters can attack enemies with kicks and punches. Enemies are typically defeated by one hit, but bosses and wrestling opponents need multiple hits to defeat.
title: Kinnikuman: Kinnikusei Ōi Sōdatsusen

description:
Gallus and his demonic force of youkai are invading Earth. Only Akira with his unique ESP gift has the ability to stop this invasion. Yōkai Club is an action game which consists of six stages with each stage ending with a boss that must be defeated.

Akira can jump and crouch and initially comes equipped with his Psycho Stinger throwing knives that he can use on his enemies. Akira has a power meter which lets him take multiple attacks from enemies. Akira also has an experience bar that can be slowly filled by EXP balls dropped from defeated enemies or by collecting an EXP book which will add a lot more experience compared to the EXP balls. Collecting enough experience will increase Akira's attack power,

Akira can find items such as flashlights which can temporarily freeze enemies and bombs which will destroy any enemy in its vicinity. Other items include shooting stars items which increases Akira's speed and medicine which gives Akira temporary invincibility.
title: Yōkai Club

description:
Based on the manga turned anime, Pro Golfer Saru: Kage no Tournament is a golf game starring the young golfer Sarumaru Sarutani.

The main game consists of a tournament mode which contains two 18 hole golf courses. The prehistoric themed Ryu course and the more modern themed Tecno course. While the courses have traditional hazards like bunkers and water traps, there are also nontraditional hazards to contend with such as whirlwinds, turbines, and critters. Players can select from a handful of golf clubs and choose where they want the club to make contact with the golf ball, then aim where they want the ball to go, and hit the ball by gauging the amount of power using the swing meter.

There is also a training mode that lets the player practice their golf game.
title: Pro Golfer Saru: Kage no Tournament

description:
In Reflect World, players take control of a futuristic hover tank while exploring a hostile planet. Shooting down enemies earns the player gold. which can be spent at weapon shops. At a weapon shop, players can purchase different ammo sizes for their main cannon, the class of their generator, increased capacity for their fuel tank, and fuel for their fuel tank. Also for sale are items that affect how the tank fires out its ammo. Fuel is the most important thing to keep track of since getting hit by enemy fire decreases it and the game ends when all the fuel is empty.

The majority of the game consists of exploring the planet surface searching for dungeon entrances, finding the way through said dungeons to get to the exit, in order to get to different parts of the planet.
title: Reflect World

description:
Espitenen und Herr Pimponen is a fast-paced platform game based on the Espinete's Big Trouble demo previously featured in Mojonian Tales. It stars the characters Espitenen (very similar to the Espinete character) and Herr Pimponen, with three game modes. The game can be played solo, going through the ten stages in a fixed order as one of the two characters, a cooperative two-player mode and a competitive two-player mode.

Each level consists of a large vertically oriented environment with platforms. The goal is to reach the top of the stage or to finish with most points. The characters start at the bottom and after the initial platforms the screen starts scrolling vertically at a fixed speed. If a character touches the bottom of the screen a life is lost right away. Quick jumping is required to keep progressing while collecting items for points. Both enemies can shoot in the opposite direction they are facing. They cannot hurt each other, but enemies can be taken out that way. The characters can however hinder each other, through bumping. When not touching the bottom of the screen a number of hits can be taken and health can be replenished by picking up red hearts. Levels have different themes and gameplay elements such as quicksand platforms or spikes. It is possible to jump through certain platforms while other are solid.

sample_screenshots.caption: A level played in the rain.
Lots of fruit to collect for points.

title: Espitenen und Herr Pimponen

description:
Cosmo Police: Galivan for the NES is very different from the other versions and a game that belongs to the Metroidvania genre, being primarily a Metroid (NES)-style game with a few RPG elements added to the formula such as an experience point-based leveling system, melee weapons that grow stronger through usage and NPCs that hand out gameplay clues.

The player explores an interconnected world in a sci-fi setting which gradually opens up as one gains new abilities (such as the late game jet boots which let you fly temporarily with each use, and some special weapons which let you open new paths by destroying walls), destroys computers and beats bosses. The abilities all cost energy (called CP in this game) to use.

Interestingly for the time and platform, the game features an auto-save feature that triggers at certain points. Loading a save makes your experience points go down to the minimum for your current level while your main weapon's (the blade) level stays the same.

sample_screenshots.caption: Beamed down in front of a cave
Making my way down the cave

title: Cosmo Police: Galivan

description:
Cool World exists as an alternate dimension to this world where cartoon doodles are alive. An object called the Golden Spike of Power keeps both dimensions balanced in harmony. It was placed on top of the Ocean Hotel in Las Vegas for safekeeping. However a doodle named Holli Would want the power of the Golden Spike so she can become a real human, but in doing so may cause both worlds to come to ruin. She also ripped up a map into five pieces which shown how the tunnels connected between this world and Cool World. So now it's up to Detective Frank Harris to track down the map pieces and put a stop to Holli's plans.

Detective Frank Harris can jump, crouch, and use weapons to dispatch Holli's henchmen. Weapons include a pen, eraser, and bombs. Other items include bottles (used in conjunction with the pen), hearts which give Frank an extra life, food items which give Frank energy, and special area specific weapons. The game is broken into four different areas (Main Street - Cool World, The Highway, Main Street - Sweet Place, and Countryside near Sweet Place), with each area containing a piece of the map plus a fifth area which takes place at the hotel where Frank has to defend the Golden Spike from being stolen.

sample_screenshots.caption: There's almost no spot where no-one shoots or throws things at you
Dodging a police wire and trying to avoid the electricity from the wires

title: Cool World

description:
This release contains the following games in a single cartridge:

  • Ninja Jajamaru-kun
  • Esper Boukentai
  • Pinball Quest

All three games are in their original Japanese language.
title: 8-Bit Collection: Jaleco Vol. 2

description:
This release contains the following games in a single cartridge:

  • BurgerTime
  • Side Pocket
  • Bad Dudes
  • Buggy Popper (Bump 'N' Jump)
  • Daikaijuu Deburasu
  • Dark Lord

All games are in their original Japanese language.
title: 8-Bit Collection: Data East Vol. 1

description:
Honey Bunny has been taken captive and Bugs Bunny is off to rescue her. Bugs has to contend with those rascals Daffy Duck, Sylvester, Wiley Coyote, and Yosemite Sam who intend to stop him from completing this task.

The game consists of sixty levels. Bugs must collect all the carrots on a level to beat it. This is not as straight forward as it seems as levels are typically maze like with many stairs and pipes that have to be navigated for Bugs to find all the carrots. Also, while Bugs is trying to find his way he'll have enemies constantly chasing him. He can deal with these enemies by pushing heavy objects on top of them or find boxing gloves that let him punch his adversaries. Bugs can also find an item called Magic Carrot Juice which gives him temporary invincibility.

This version should not be confused with the same titled Game Boy version which has its own unique level layouts.

sample_screenshots.caption: US Title Screen. That wascally wabbit!
Wile E. Coyote lay wounded on the floor.
Japanese Roger Rabbit instructs players to flip over the diskette
The first level of the Crazy Castle. There are 80 (yes, eighty!) levels in all.

title: The Bugs Bunny Crazy Castle

description:
The Famicom Disk System version of Knight Lore features changes from the original version. While the game features the same general gameplay flow of finding items and bringing them back to a central location, some changes to the gameplay were made.

The game is now broken up into nine different stages consisting of eleven rooms each. This change also increases the number of items to find from eight to eleven and now there are eighty days instead of forty to complete the game. The ability to move objects in order to reach items that was present in the original game has been removed with this version of the game featuring more straight forward platforming challenges instead.

sample_screenshots.caption: Your character turns into a werewolf every once in a while. But the control still stinks.
This guy seems to want things you find around the forest...
You can use three save slots to keep tabs of your progress.
Hey, a ring! Wonder what it does.

title: Knight Lore: Majou no Ookami Otoko

description: The Cowlitz Gamers' 2nd Adventure, like the name implies, is a sequel to the original Cowlitz Gamers Adventure. It's a platformer where you play as a girl named Kaylee who is trying to first traverse a mine and then ascend a tower. Along the way, you collect treasures and avoid enemies. The goal is just to get from one screen to the next and eventually get to the top of the tower.
title: The Cowlitz Gamers' 2nd Adventure

description:
Kamen Rider Black: Taiketsu Shadow Moon is a side-scrolling action platform game based on the science fiction television series of the same name.

The player takes a role of Kamen Rider Black (also known as Kotaro Minami) with his living motorcycle Battle Hopper on some of the levels. He fights against the mysterious criminal group called Gorgom and their vicious mutants. The protagonist has several special abilities to perform during his mission but at the cost of health.

The game is divided into six stages and the first three of them consist of four rounds, the next two - of three and the last one is fully dedicated to the final battle with Shadow Moon - the main antagonist in Kamen Rider Black: Taiketsu Shadow Moon. Also, each round ends with its own boss.
title: Kamen Rider Black: Taiketsu Shadow Moon

description:
Kamen Rider Club: Gekitotsu Shocker Land is a both role-playing and action platform hybrid game set in the Kamen Rider sci-fi universe.

There are three main protagonists with a unique stats to play as: Kamen Rider 1 (also known as Takeshi Hongo), Kamen Rider 2 (also known as Hayato Ichimonji), Kamen Rider V3 (also known as Shiro Kazami). Their mission is to defeat the villains from the evil organizations called Shocker and Gel-Shocker.

The player has a choice to kill the enemy instantly or to switch into a special battle mode where he must press a button as fast as possible in order to win the combat. Each killed enemy gives money and experience for leveling up. It is also possible to make money by playing roulette. Money can be spent for hiring mercenaries to assist during the fights.
title: Kamen Rider Club: Gekitotsu Shocker Land

description:
Kamen Rider SD: GranShocker no Yabou is a digital board game with RPG elements based on the Kamen Rider SD manga and is a part of the Kamen Rider universe.

There are three teams to choose the characters from: Battle Team (Kamen Rider 1, Kamen Rider ZX, Kamen Rider Black RX), Wild Team (Kamen Rider 2, Kamen Rider Amazon, Kamen Rider Stronger), Mechanic Team (Kamen Rider V3, Kamen Rider X, Kamen Rider Super-1). They have to stop an evil organization called GranShocker and save the world from their terrible plans.

Each rider has three important parameters: speed level, endurance, fuel capacity. Defeating the enemies gives the experience that allows to level up the characters and to increase their stats; it also gives money to buy various items in the stores (additionally the player can make money by gambling at the casinos).
title: Kamen Rider SD: GranShocker no Yabō

description: While the game keeps the same story as the MSX version, this version features some alterations. The number of dungeons has been reduced from ten to five, however the dungeons have been increased in size and feature redesigned layouts. Other differences include the game featuring a larger character sprite, scrolling instead of a flip-screen, and spell incantations are done with button presses instead of typing in words, among other changes

sample_screenshots.caption: The story of Maze Of Galious
This is a door that can be passed from one side.

title: Majō Densetsu II: Daimashikyō Galious

description: Fairy Pinball: Yousei-tachi no Pinball is a homebrew pinball game with an anime theme. It contains two tables: Asteroid and Midway. Each table is vertically aligned and takes up two screens. Midway features on a naval battle and Asteroid has space exploration as a theme.

sample_screenshots.caption: An image shown after having won the game.

title: Fairy Pinball: Yousei-tachi no Pinball

description: AO is a homebrew puzzle game. Each of the 33 levels consists of a fixed, single screen environment where a brick needs to be guided to a goal pit (exit point) in a maze-like environment shown through a top-down view. The brick is controlled directly and the view is in 2D, but the player needs to think in 3D to solve the puzzle. The brick takes up two spaces when it is laying on its side and one space when it is standing up. To get around in the maze the brick often needs to be brought into a specific position so it can move without falling off the edge. For instance: some passages only have room for a single space and then the brick cannot pass unless it is in a good position. When falling off the ledge the level restarts right away and there are unlimited lives. Gradually additional elements are introduced such as switches, teleportation blocks and weak floors. The game contains a competitive two-player mode where two players move through the maze simultaneously with the goal to reach the exit first. The game provides 1,000 seconds to complete the game, but it is possible to continue playing even when time has run out.

sample_screenshots.caption: Here the brick is standing up in the third level because it only takes up one space (the orange part).
A tricky maze in level five.
Here the brick is laying on its side, taking up two spaces in this fourth level.
This is the first level with some items explained in the bottom part of the screen.

title: AO

description:
Beerslinger is a time management game with a concept similar to the arcade classic Tapper. It is the second game in the Holiday series by the developer, this time made for Saint Patrick's Day.

The player controls a bartender who needs to serve customers in a pub. Each level is a different day and introduces two bars, one with the beers on tap and one where customers sit down and order. Based on the customer's order the bartender needs to fill up the mug with the correct type of beer (e.g. IPA, lager, stout, wheat) and serve it in time. A timer below the customer's stool shows the remaining time and if the bartender messes up three times by being too late or serving the wrong type, he is fired and the game is over. The goal is to make it through the seven days of the week. Each day also has a cash target.

A single button is used to fill up the mug and then again to serve it. The second button is used to empty the mug when it does not contain the correct type of beer to get rid of it. The customers order using a voice sample expressing their choice in addition to the next on screen. Levels gradually get more difficult, introducing multiple types of beer and more room for patrons who also turn up faster. Starting with two kegs and two stools the game ends with four kegs and six stools.

sample_screenshots.caption: It is getting busy with three kegs on the third day.
Notice the timer below the customer.

title: Beerslinger

description:
This Limited Edition includes:* Get'em Gary (NES cartridge version)

  • Bomb stress ball
  • Branded black metal lunchbox to hold all the content
  • Full page comic strip featuring characters of the game
  • Knitted Gary beanie
  • Limited edition box and cartridge artwork
  • Poster with limited edition artwork (18"x24")
  • Turbo Burger gummy candy

It was put up for sale through an online auction with five copies, with starting price of $150. When the auction ended two copies were sold.
title: Get'em Gary (Limited Edition)

description:
Family Picross is a homebrew picross puzzle game. It keeps the classic puzzle game formula using the numbers on top and to the left of each row and column to fill in the boxes. The player controls the cursor directly and moves over the boxes. A single button is used to toggle between the three box states: selected, crossed out or open.

There are more than 100 puzzles to complete, starting from very small puzzles to large and complex ones. Options including entering a name, a selection between three music tracks, stopping the cursor at the edges or allowing it to wrap around, and the ability to continue using a password. A password is provided after completing each puzzle. The game also keeps track of the high scores as puzzles have a time limit. Completing puzzles in a short time provides more points. It is possible to continue playing and complete the puzzle even when time has run out, but that costs one of the three lives provided.

The game is available as a ROM download and a successful Kickstarter campaign was launched to provide a cartridge version in three varieties: box, loose cartridge and a solutionist version with a solutions guide to all puzzles.
title: Family Picross

description:
NES Virus Cleaner is a homebrew arcade game and a spoof of the NES Cleaning Kit. Players guide the hero Clik through the inside of a NES console to grab the viruses that appear in various locations on the screen. Each level consists of a single, fixed screen and Clik can be moved around freely. To complete the level and move on to the next one, a certain number of viruses need to be captured before time runs out.

Clik is slowed down in his movement especially because of electric bolts, sparks, homing missiles and disappearing blocks in the environment. Clik has no means to attack and can only move, so a lot of evasion is required. When the character is hit it respawns in the location where the last virus was captured. To help Clik get around fast when almost out of time he can drop a teleporter at any location to quickly shift to that place, but at the cost of 1,000 points. Once deployed it is possible to cancel the teleporter to drop it in a new location.

Each level is built around a component of the NES console with a brief introduction by Clik as a guide. The character also explains all the dangers in that level. Points are scored for every captured virus (50 points), but they also provide additional time. If Clik gets hit a life is lost as well as 100 points.

sample_screenshots.caption: Moving to the right to capture a virus.
Here is Clik again, between levels.

title: NES Virus Cleaner

description:
Log Jammers is a homebrew arcade sports game. It is similar to the PC and console versions of the same name and by the same developer. Those versions are not identical and described as an "upmake" of the NES version. The game borrows elements from Windjammers, which served as an inspiration.

Players select one of six characters from a cast with names such as Rad Carlton, Bruiser Bogardus, Hot Foot Francis, Sparerib Boneapart, Mayo Monsoon or Ollie Oilsack. There are also multiple environments and different game modes. The characters are described as lumberjacks. Matches take place on a fixed screen view shown from an elevated position. Characters are standing on rolling logs and throw an axe that acts like a ball.

In a typical tournament different opponents need to be defeated one after the other. Points are scored by throwing the axe into the goal area behind the opponent. This zone is different for each environment. Sometimes there is only a single, large goal area, while another environment has three zones for five, two and five points respectively. In some levels like North Pool the middle part is entirely open, while in others like Mount Olympus the axe can only be thrown through a few open passages.

The opponent guards these areas and attempts to catch or bounce back the axe to try the same on the other side. A set is won when someone reaches twelve points. The best of three sets wins a match. Special items appear during matches such as stars (use a signature throw different for each character), magnets (increase catching range for five seconds), ice cubes (decrease the opponent's movement speed for a short amount of time) and oil (the axe cannot be caught for five seconds and will bounce back instead, and at a reduced speed). There are counters for some power-ups. For instance, when the signature throw is caught by the opponent, their signature throw becomes active right away.

The game supports competitive multiplayer against another opponent on the same screen. The game comes in a box with a green cartridge and a full colour manual.
title: Log Jammers

description:
This Limited Edition includes:* Log Jammers (on a cartridge)

  • Custom cartridge crafted from real wood with acrylic inlays, grain detail, sanded and stained
  • Full colour manual
  • Premium box for packaging
title: Log Jammers (Limited Edition)

description:
Journey to the Centre of the Alien is a futuristic homebrew 2D platform game starring Special Agent PDT-6. She is deployed at an unknown location on a secret mission. The game consists of several levels where strange eggs need to be located and picked up, before returning to the relay station at the starting position. Levels consist of several single, fixed screen linked together using the flip-screen mechanic and there is a small amount of freedom to explore and complete the level in a non-linear way.

Special Agent PDT-6 wears a cybernetic suit that provides some abilities such as swimming, double jumping and using her bum to bounce off enemies without being hurt. Gameplay involves a lot of platform elements such as precise movement and timing to avoid enemy patterns. Enemies cannot be killed. Certain parts of the environment are also deadly, such as sharp stones and spikes in the floor. A single encounter with an enemy or a hazard immediately removes one of the five starting lives. Additional objects can be collected as well. The HUD can be used to track how many eggs need to be located. When dead, the agent respawns right away and when the game is over it is possible to restart the entire game or to continue the last level.

The game debuted in the 2019 compilation Mojonian Tales. The title references the game Journey to the Center of the Earth and a spoof of that game was previously explored in the developer's 2010 Viaje al centro de la napia.

sample_screenshots.caption: An entire screen filled with goo.
A tricky section where you will need to use her "bum" move to get across.
You can swim through the green goo. In this screen there is an additional object to pick up.

title: Journey to the Centre of the Alien

description:
Nomolos: Storming the CATsle is a homebrew 2D side-scrolling platformer starring a cat in armour called Nomolos. The story starts when two cats, Solomon and Snow, are playing together when a portal suddenly appears. A giant purple arm shoots out from it and yanks Snow inside. Solomon follows right away and is transported, becoming the feline warrior Nomolos in the process. Going through twelve levels (with an additional hidden bonus level / warp zone) Nomolos pursues the purple enemy that is brining snow to the CATsle.

In addition to the platforming there are many enemy types and three weapons, both melee and ranged. Power-ups can also be found and picking up a mouse restores a heart. The game contains five boss encounters and there are three difficulty levels selected from the main menu. The game music contains chiptune renditions of famous classical music composers.

sample_screenshots.caption: Introduction screen for the first level
Fighting a tree that launches bats.
The first scene of the game

title: Nomolos: Storming the CATsle

description:
Darkman is an adventure game developed and published by Ocean Software. The title released in 1991 and 1992 for Gameboy, was also available for NES, Commodore 64, Amstrad CPC, Amiga, ZX Spectrum, and Atari ST and was the first entry in a saga with two other titles.

Similar to the movie of the same name, Darkman used to be a scientist exploring applications of a new synthetic skin useful for fire victims. The investigation was interrupted when a gang of mobsters entered his lab looking for a document, killing his assistant in the middle and leaving him seriously injured. At the same time, the scientist used a new surgical treatment that granted him immunity to pain, superhuman strength, but in exchange for intense impulses of anger and adrenaline. Thus, swearing vengeance against the gang of mobsters with a bandage covering his burned face in the criminal attack, Darkman was born.

The game is a side-scrolling platformer at times, in which the main character must advance through the levels using masks of their victims, attacking enemies, and jumping obstacles. The masks are obtained in the photography mode, where the game changes to a first-person perspective and the user must photograph the criminal to copy his face. These mini-games of photographs are vital for the resolution of the platform levels since the duration of the mask in the next level will depend on the quality of the photos that the player takes.

sample_screenshots.caption: Take photos of Durant's men so you can impersonate them
The better the pictures the better the score

title: Darkman

description:
Days of Thunder: Unreleased Version is a prototype for a tie-in racing video game developed by Chris Oberth at Mindscape for the 1990 Paramount Pictures film of the same name starring Tom Cruise.

Mindscape ultimately decided to cancel the in-house development of the game and outsourced it to Beam Software, work that was eventually released as Days of Thunder.

In 2020, the Video Game History Foundation recovered the source code from Oberth's developing materials and used it to make a small print run of Days of Thunder cartridges, compatible with Nintendo Entertainment System as a fundraiser for Oberth’s widow. Once the game was sold out, the source code was published on GitHub.
title: Days of Thunder: Unreleased Version

description: Cheril in the Cave is a 2D platformer originally created in 2017 but released for the first time in 2020. Players control the character Cheril in a series of caves presented as fixed-screen environments linked together using the flip-screen mechanic. The game is slow and requires precise platform jumping to avoid hazards such as blades and slime, as well as enemies. There is some freedom to explore as often objects such as a floppy disk are needed to activate a terminal elsewhere and proceed. The character starts with five lives and every encounter immediately removes one. It is possible to jump on top of characters, but this will not kill them. Certain enemies such as bats can be killed by luring them into slime. The game starts with a short tutorial.

sample_screenshots.caption: Quickly jump up to the next screen to evade the bat.
Use the platforms to get to the other side.
The starting area of the real game

title: Cheril in the Cave

sample_screenshots.caption: Kraken tentacle pushes up a column of blocks

description: Battle Storm is a strategy game where players can follow their own strategies with tanks, airplanes, military bases and non-nuclear missiles, and stage a fictional World War III and to simulate modern warfare. There are nine stages. There is support for matches against another human player.
title: Battle Storm

description: Platformer based on the fairy tale "Jack and the Beanstalk". Stages progress from the ground to a beanstalk, the clouds, an airship and the giant's castle. Some stages scroll vertically rather than horizontally, for example when scaling the beanstalk. Various items can be found that increase Jack's jump height or bean-throwing attack.
title: Jumpin' Kid: Jack to Mame no Ki Monogatari

description: The young hero Bam sets out on a journey to rescue his parents, who have been transformed into monsters. His journey through a large game world ends bringing him into conflict with the clan of the evil Domes and a quest to save the world itself. Luckily, he's equipped with his trusty sword, which he can upgrade over the course of the game, and defeating enemies lets him collect little bits of fire which can be used as currency at shops. Players explore the world from a side-view perspective, similar to Zelda II or Ys III; as they defeat bosses and explore dungeons, the world itself expands, giving them new places to explore.

sample_screenshots.caption: The start of the game, outside of your house
Dungeon floors are connected by elevators

title: Fire Bam

description:
This unlicensed rally simulation was initially developed by Hal Laboratory and released in Australia in 1991, then ported to the Famicom by Kaken in 1992 under the title Exciting Rally: World Rally Championship.

The game is played from a top-down perspective, and the controls themselves are rather simple: button A allows you to drive at low speed, button B at a higher speed, and the down arrow doubles as brakes and reverse gear. Arrows will indicate some, but not all, turns, and you will have to keep an eye out for jumps and obstacles. Your car will accrue damage each time you bump into something, until it finally explodes and you have to retire from the stage.

Two game modes are available. You can drive through an entire championship with up to seven other human players. Three classes serving as a difficulty setting, and the competition will take you to ten different countries, where you will have to compete against the times set by AI (and possibly human) opponents across several stages. Or you can play against two to eight other players in the Battle mode, setting a time one after another on your selected stage.

There is some level of tuning, with the possibility of choosing your tyres according to the surface (tarmac, gravel or snow), whether you want a turbo, and between two and four-wheel drive for each stage. Once a lap, you can also change your tyres when the letters "SP" appear on the screen ; simply come to a stop and press Select.

sample_screenshots.caption: The road in Monte Carlo was cleared of snow, so it's all tarmac
The Argentine stage has some puddles
The points are attributed after all the stages of a location are done

title: Championship Rally

description:
Jay and Silent Bob Mall Brawl Premium Edition is a special edition of Jay and Silent Bob: Mall Brawl. It contains the following:

  • Individually numbered, foil-stamped rigid book style box that opens gatefold style to reveal the interior contents
  • Jay and Silent Bob Mall Brawl game on physical cartridge for NES (with a dust cover).
  • A set of collectible art cards
  • Jay and Silent Bob Mall Brawl soundtrack on physical CD
  • Full-color booklet/manual.
  • Reversible 18 x 24 inch poster.
title: Jay and Silent Bob: Mall Brawl (Premium Edition)

description:
In the year 2300, humans established an Earth federation and journeyed into space to colonize the surrounding planets. However, an alien species began attacking the humans, putting humanity's survival at stake. Though it was only a matter of time before Earth fell to the power of the enemies, the Earth's army commander issued an order calling all of the units dispersed around the colonized planets to return to Earth. The player takes the role of a young soldier who was stationed with the Rayieza unit on the planet Mars, and his journey begins as he makes his way back to Earth along with the other members of his unit.

Ginga no Sannin is based on Chikyū Senshi Rayieza, a PC game produced by Enix. It was produced by Nintendo and involved key members of the Rayieza team.
title: Ginga no Sannin

description:
In Dreamworld Pogie you control Pogie the Fluffle, who first appeared in the Dizzy game series as Dizzy's pet. In this scrolling platform collecting game, your goal is to travel through the 15 levels of Candyland, searching for the exit portals, whilst avoiding contact with the inhabitants. You can optionally collect sweets for points and stars, of which 100 will give you an extra life. Movement is simply left, right, and jump. You can use rising bubbles or mushrooms to reach higher places and collecting a 'Fizzola' temporarily gives Pogie extra speed and invincibility, useful if you want to speed run the level without bothering with the collecting. Touching any eggs you find will create a respawn checkpoint. There is no in-game timer, so it can be played at your own pace. There is an alternating 2 player option, whereby the 2nd player controls the female Fluffle, Rosie. In this mode, if you die you must collect all the stars again, unlike in 1P mode.

This game was written by Philip and Andrew Oliver in 1992 but not released due to the publisher, Camerica, going into administration. The source code of an almost complete build was later rediscovered by the twins in 2011 and a prototype demo was created and released online. In 2016, Team Yolkfolk finished the game and a crowdfunding campaign for a cartridge version was successfully funded. The completed version was also made available for free online. It has since been included on the Oliver Twins Collection cartridge for the Evercade.

sample_screenshots.caption: The more demonic-looking Pogie now that he is invincible.
The first level at the bottom of the screen. Enter it to advance to the next level or carry on collecting stars and sweets.
Using a bubble to reach those higher platforms.

title: Dreamworld Pogie

description: The player controls a tank in a battlefield. To win in the battlefield, the player must eliminate all opposition including tanks and infantry. Different levels have different terrain types, some of which can slow the tank down. If the player's tank gets destroyed, the player takes control of a soldier and must attempt to get a replacement tank.
title: Bakutōshi Patton-Kun

description: The Magnilo Case is an action game. You play as detective Smith and are assigned to investigate the mysterious disappearance of several actors from Magnilo Movie Studios, and figure out who murdered Detective Jones. The game is an homage to classic NES games and contains many references to other games.
title: The Magnilo Case

description: Fami-chan's back, and she has more stars to collect! This expanded, enhanced version of Kira Kira Star Night features essentially the same plot and gameplay. This outing features significantly enhanced graphics, with much more animation and complex colours, along with new levels and new music by chiptune artists.

sample_screenshots.caption: Starting out in the first stage!

title: Kira Kira Star Night DX

description: Spirit Impel began life as a Byte-Off 2020 game jam submission by Passe Gaming. It was later developed into a full fledged game, completed several months later. It features plenty of "tongue in check" humor as you take on the role of Vin Katana, who must defeat the intergalactic corporation Ultra before they turn every video game in the universe into a pachinko machine. It appears the villains of the game are a parody of Konami. In gameplay terms the game is fairly straight forward, you make your way through six stages avoiding obstacles, shooting enemies and each stage ends with a boss fight.

sample_screenshots.caption: The first stage of Spirit Impel.
More cutscene featuring Vin Katana's back story.
Watch out for the first boss, the space octopus!
Opening cutscene detailing the crimes of the Intergalactic Corporation Ultra!

title: Spirit Impel

description:
Backgammon is a video game adaptation of the millenniums-old board game of the same name. It was developed for Nintendo's Famicom Disk System peripheral, with supervision by the Japan Backgammon Association.

The game offers several modes of play. The Demonstration and Training Play modes help ease the player into the world of Backgammon, as well as get a feel for the game's controls. Match Play is a standard exhibition match against the computer. Tournament Play is the main part of the game where the player must face off against increasingly more difficult AI opponents. Each mode has its own color scheme and music. If the player manages to beat the hardest AI in Tournament Mode, they are awarded a Certificate of Commendation by the Japan Backgammon Association. There is also a 2 Player exhibition mode available for play.
title: Backgammon

description:
On a planet in the Q Galaxy, there exists the Rainbow Flower. One day the evil Dr. Mouse steals the Rainbow Flower and plans to use it to rule the planet. The brave Q-Boy must defeat Dr. Mouse and get the Rainbow Flower back.

Q Boy is a platformer superficially resembling a Kirby game, but playing somewhat differently. The main character has a limited, recharging power meter that is used to blow out puffs of air, which can be used to do multiple jumps in the air, or can be fired against enemies. Enemies are defeated by using the air puffs to push them into walls or into each other. If the power meter is fully discharged, Q Boy becomes exhausted and is unable to move until the meter has fully recharged. There are five worlds with four stages each. Each world ends with a boss fight and has a bonus stage where extra lives can be won.

sample_screenshots.caption: Q Boy is exhausted after emptying the power meter

title: Q Boy

description:
One day in the year 2100, a UFO from an alien planet suddenly appeared and attacked the Earth. A young brother and sister were hiding from the UFO, but somehow have warped into another dimension together with the UFO. There the girl meets a robot who was tracking the UFO. Together with the robot, the girl must reach the UFO's base to rescue her brother and return back home.

Miracle Ropit's Adventure in 2100 is an action platformer featuring the titular robot, piloted by a young girl. When the robot is hit, it will break down and dump the girl out. The girl cannot shoot enemies, and will die after 30 seconds if she cannot restore the robot, which requires special items. The game often requires shooting at or jumping on certain unmarked spots repeatedly, either to uncover secrets or even to make progress in a stage at all. In order to reach the true ending, two loops of the game must be beaten.

It is the first game of the Rubble Saver series, which continued on Game Boy.

sample_screenshots.caption: The robot took a hit, now the girl is on her own
Opening the door to the exit requires a secret combination of actions

title: Miracle Ropit's Adventure in 2100

description:
Galf is a retro throwback golf game that was originally part of the 2017 golf game Golf Story. It was released standalone as a fully functional NES cartridge in 2018. The game consists of nine holes and controls very similarly to Golf on the NES. The holes feature a variety of typical golf course traps and hazards. The position of your ball, what type of grass you're hitting it out of, and the current wind speed all affect your ball's power and accuracy.

As an additional bonus to the physical release, there is now a two-player mode, where each player takes their entire turn finishing the hole before the other player is allowed to tee off.

sample_screenshots.caption: Shooting into a hazard with humorous results

title: Galf

description:
The world of Fern was in turmoil until the knight Emmerich wins a battle over the evil Glory, and seals Glory's soul inside a candle. Since then, peace has reigned.

A soldier named Farreth was summoned before King Millem of Elmia. The king tells Farreth that the Magic Candle at Teth Sanctuary needs Farreth to protect it. The previous guardian, General Guilles, has left his post, as he is now rebelling against the King. Later while Farreth was at home with his wife Minea, he tells his son of his mission. However his son is coming of age and so Farreth wants him to gain some experience and sends him on a mission to deliver a letter to the priest in Moelin Village.

However during the deliverance of the letter to the priest in Moelin. one of General Guilles henchman attacks and steals the Time Bracelet. The priest was fatally injured during the attack, but before expiring he hands Farreth's son a Time Shard, a key component of the Time Bracelet, and tells him to bring the Time Shard to his father in Elmia.

However after Farreth's son leaves Moelin, he sees that the ship he took there was destroyed and now must go on a long journey back to his father in Elmia so they can deal with General Guilles and his minions. This is where the player steps in, as they take on the role of Farreth's son.

Magic Candle is an RPG in the same vein of the first Dragon Quest. The game features only one character to play as, as there are no other party member to recruit.

Players travel on an overworld going from village to village and will also have to visit hostile locations. While on the overworld or visiting a hostile location, players can go into first person turn based random battles. During battles, players select from the following battle commands; Attack, Magic, Items, and Escape. Beaten monsters drop gold and give experience. Defeating enough monsters will eventually earn the player enough experience for the player to level up which will increase their stats.

While in a village, players can open chests to find items and gold, talk to villagers, shop, sleep at an inn to restore health, and pray at a church in order to save their game.

sample_screenshots.caption: There is no world map: the transition between towns and wilderness is smooth

title: The Magic Candle

description:
In the year 2102 A.D., a ray of light falls from the sky, secretly carrying invaders to our planet. After building their base deep underground, amidst the ruins of an ancient human civilization, they launch their invasion a year later. A lone warrior must now journey underground to destroy the heart of the enemy base, in order to save Earth and the human race.

Fire Rock is an action platformer for the Famicom Disk System. In each of the six vertically scrolling stages, you have to defeat four bosses and find four key items to unlock the exit, while exploring a maze of doors and caverns. The barbarian-like protagonist is only armed with throwing torches, which can be upgraded to the eponymous Fire Rock. All walls are climbable, to help in the vertical traversal of the stages. One of the more unique mechanics is that collecting meat items increases your jump height, and higher jumps are sometimes required to reach items or progress to new locations in a stage.

sample_screenshots.caption: Slipped and fell into the lava
Skeleton Werebat, another boss in stage 1

title: Fire Rock

description:
Jeffrey Wittenhagen's Black Box Challenge is a role-playing game similar to the Japanese RPGs that existed on the NES during its heyday. Like any RPG, the main character levels up and acquires new skills and items. Unlike most RPGs, the overarching goal is to acquire a complete set of NES "black box" games. As the player acquires each game, they can play a mini-game inspired by it on their in-game NES, and thereby acquire new skills to use in the main quest.

The game had multiple releases and editions via Kickstarter.
title: Jeffrey Wittenhagen's Black Box Challenge

description:
Takahashi Meijin no Bug-tte Honey is a side-scrolling action game that uses characters from the TV anime "Bug tte Honey" (1986-1987) based on the game Adventure Island of Takahashi Meijin.

Takahashi Meijin has been kidnapped by the Great King Kyura and Honey, a bee fairy girl, has to rescue him. In the first stage of the game the player controls Honey who has the ability to fly and shoot heart bullets. After being rescued by Bug-tte, Takahashi becomes a player character in the second and later stages. He throws a stone ax to attack his enemies, but cannot remove obstacles like fire and rocks. That is only possible if he takes a power-up item for the third time to turn his weapon into fireballs.

In order to defeat the boss of each stage, the player has to find eight hidden eggs to get the eight correct letters of the password that will unlock the doors of the final building. Unlike the later stages there is no boss to fight in the first one. Touching an egg will send the player to a Breakout/Arkanoid-like stage. Like Arkanoid the player must keep a ball in play by manoeuvring a paddle beneath the ball so that it does not fall through the bottom of the screen. However, in this game, each paddle stage is composed of two screens aligned vertically and thus the player controls two paddles. That means if the ball passes from the bottom screen to the top screen or the other way around, the screen changes automatically.

To complete these stages, the player must first collect the one correct letter from the four letters that may fall from one of the blocks after hitting them. The screen will flash white if the right letter has been collected. Then every block from the upper screen must be cleared to open the gate in the ceiling. Once the gate is open, the ball has to be shoot through it to get back to the action stage. Collecting the wrong letter instead, will make the screen flash red and the player will lose a paddle. This will also happen if the player miss the ball with the pad on the bottom screen. Losing all the paddles will reduce the remaining lives in the action mode by one.

The player starts with three lives and a life meter, but there are no continues.

sample_screenshots.caption:
Stage 1 with Honey. It's possible to return to the left.

The theme music that you now hear is a rendition of the opening theme which is played in the anime upon which the game is based.
This will also happen if you collect the Star. Then for a certain period of time, Honey and Takahashi will become invincible.
Yes! You got one of the right letters that you will need for the password to open the door of the last building.
The upper screen in the Break-out mode.

title: Takahashi Meijin no Bug-tte Honey

description:
In London, the city of fog, on the night of March 16, 1895, a woman knocks on the door of 221B Baker Street, where Holmes and Watson are boarding. Her name is Veronica Norton and she wants to talk about her father, Professor William Norton. Professor William Norton, who has just retired from the British Museum, left his house for a walk yesterday morning but has not returned. Veronica, afraid something has happened to him, wants Sherlock to investigate.

Meitantei Holmes: Kiri no London Satsujin Jiken is the second instalment of the Towa Chiki's Holmes series and a Japanese adventure game in which all actions can be performed through a series of menu options displayed next to a static image of the current scene, (go outside, listen to the story, enter inside, look, search, call, show, take and ?), like many Japanese graphic text adventure games.

The game is presented in first person with the exception when the "go outside" option is used. This brings up the movement mode; a 2D map where Holmes and Watson can travel on foot or by carriage to their destinations that have been revealed by clues or in conversations. When riding a horse-drawn carriage it brings up the adventure screen where you can select a destination. Then you will automatically reach your destination, but travelling by carriage costs money.

If you want to talk to people you use the "listen to the story" option. To speak with Inspector Lestrade or Inspector Gregson you will need to send a telegram from the post office first before you can visit Scotland Yard to talk to them. This also costs money. If you run out of money, you will not be able to continue the investigation.

The "look" option is to see where you are, who is there, or what you are doing. "search" will bring up a magnifying glass where you can go searching onscreen graphics for hot spots. If the person you want to speak to is not in the same room as Sherlock and Watson, but in the same building you can call them with the "call" option". The "?" option is used to change characters; from Sherlock to Watson and vice versa to do things that can only be done by Holmes or things that can only be done by Watson. As Holmes you can use the option "observe" with a keen observation eye and Watson can only use the option "Write a diary" to save the game. The option "listen to opinion" can be used to listen to Holmes (Watson)'s thoughts.

sample_screenshots.caption: Arrived at the Norton residence and speaking with Mrs. Leslie.
Veronica is talking about her father.

title: Meitantei Holmes: Kiri no London Satsujin Jiken

description:
In London, 1897, the famous violinist Gray Cornell approaches Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson in the St. James Hall Lobby. He wants to talk about a threatening letter that he received that morning. The letter said "I decided to get the famous violin instrument Stradivari that you have." The sender of the threatening letter is the villainous Professor Moriarty who is after the Stradivarius. Now at the request of Gray Cornell, Sherlock Holmes will accompany him on a violin performance tour in Europe to protect the Stradivarius.

Meitantei Holmes: M Kara no Chōsenjō is after Sherlock Holmes: Hakushaku Reijō Yūkai Jiken and Meitantei Holmes: Kiri no London Satsujin Jiken the third and final instalment of the Towa Chiki's Holmes series and a Japanese adventure game in which all actions can be performed through a series of menu options displayed next to a static image of the current scene, (Move, listen to the story, look, search, call, show, take and decipher), like many Japanese graphic text adventure games.

The game is presented in first person with the exception when at certain points of the game the "go outside" option is used. These are the tracking scenes and bring up a 3D dungeon crawl mode where Holmes will travel on foot with the use of the cross key. The direction of each key corresponds to north (up), south (down), east (right) and west (left).

If you want to talk to people you use the "listen to the story" option. The "look" option is to see where you are, who is there, or what you are doing. "search" is used to check the objects and items in that place. If the person you want to speak to is not in the same room as Sherlock and Watson, but in the same building you can call them with the "call" option". The "move" option is when you want to go out or move to another place or room. When you have found evidence you can use the option "take" to add them to your belongings. "belongings" shows what you currently have in your possession. If you want to show the evidence to other people use the option "show". "observe" is to observe the person you have met for the first time with a keen observation eye. "listen to opinion" is to hear Watson's thoughts. "decipher" is used to break the codes that are dropped by Moriarty's subordinates.

When the investigation in each country is complete, Professor Moriarty will tell you the password before going to the next country. If you enter this in the Continue, you can start the investigation from the next country. (it's by country) It is not possible to save in the middle of the investigation.

sample_screenshots.caption: Pressing the A Button to display the command screen.
Inside Knox's office; The Murder scene!
Gray Cornell: "Holmes knows Stradivari. It is one of the few famous violin instruments in the world."
Bill Knox is a concert promoter who tells Holmes that his friend Pitman, who was working with him, was killed.
Opening: Sherlock Homes at the St. James Hall Lobby; "It was a wonderful performance. Especially Cornell's violin is the best."

title: Meitantei Holmes: M Kara no Chōsenjō

description: The sequel to Gyuwambler Jiko Chūshinha. Gambler Jiko Chūshinha 2 is a Riichi mahjong game based on Masayuki Katayama's manga of the same name. The game has a free mode (play against opponents of the player's choice), a strategy game mode (players travel around Japan facing various opponents in a shōgi type game but with the twist that when the opponents pieces are attacked a round of mahjong is played to determine if the pieces are lost or not.), and a tournament mode.
title: Gyuwambler Jiko Chūshinha 2

description:
Janggun-ui Adeul is based on the Korean movie The General's Son (1990). It is set in the 1920's, during the Japanese occupation of Korea, and tells the story of Kim Doohan, a beggar and street punk who discovers that he is the son of a renowned general, and unites the lower circles of the Korean society to fight against the Japanese oppression.

The game is a 1 or 2 player fighting game. Players get to choose from eight different fighters. The fights consists of a typical win two out of three system. Each fighter has to try to knock out the other fighter by draining their life bar. Players can also rack up a high score by successfully landing hits on their opponents.
title: Janggun-ui Adeul

description:
Cadillac is a puzzle game that mixes falling blocks with poker hands.

Cards from a typical 52 card deck slowly falls in front of a 5x5 grid. Players can move each falling card to one of the five columns. The goal is to clear rounds by meeting a certain amount of money earned (depends on difficulty setting) before the deck runs out. If the player goes past the original 52 card deck, they will get $50 subtracted from their total for each extra card they need. Players can run out of money doing this which will cause the game to end when they are bankrupt. Players also have to be careful not to go six columns high or else the game will end also.

Players earn money by making a 3,4, or 5 card poker hand with the adjacent card blocks. Once a combination is made the cards involved will disappear off the playfield. Three of a kind is the lowest value poker hand accepted.

The game also gives the player an option to pause the game in a frozen state so they can study the playfield.. However the player will only be given a total of 99 seconds of this type of paused gameplay as otherwise having the game paused will present the player a blocked off view of the playfield.

The single player game has ten levels to play through with each level increasing the speed of the falling card blocks. The game also has a two-player VS. mode where players take turns trying to take points from each other.
title: Cadillac

description:
Great Deal can be considered another iteration of Cadillac. It is a puzzle game that mixes falling blocks with poker hands.

While playing similar to Cadillac, some gameplay differences should be noted. Players can now make hands diagonally, the next upcoming cards can be shuffled to a few different sets, the addition of a joker card, and the freeze pause has been extended to 200 seconds. The game contains nine levels to play through with the blocks falling faster the higher the level.
title: Great Deal

description: Jajamaru Ninpō Chō is a Japanese-style role-playing game. Princess Sakura's father has four separate quests for Jajamaru to complete. Jajamaru travels around the world visiting towns and fighting monsters he comes across in the overworld and dungeons. Monster battles are of the random turn based variety where Jajamaru can attack, use jutsu (magic), use items, escape, or defend. Defeated monsters drop money and earn Jajamaru experience so he can get stronger. Jajamaru doesn't have to fight alone, as he can have Princess Sakura join him.
title: Jajamaru Ninpō Chō

description:
Perfect Bowling as the name suggests is an electronic game of bowling. The game consists of four modes.

Training Mode lets the player practice ten frames of bowling with their own set-up and no competition.

Game Mode allows the player to choose to play between 1-5 games of bowling against one of the eight bowlers they can pick from. Players get to choose their bowler's portrait, enter their name, choose the hand they bowl with, and the weight of the bowling ball (from 8 to 16 lbs).

VS Mode allows competition between 2 to 4 human players.

Doubles Mode lets players set up teams of human players and let the players take turns bowling. The team with the highest score at the end wins.

When bowling, the player can choose the position of where to throw the ball from and the angle of their aim. Players can also add spin to the ball. Once everything's set, the player has to use a power meter to determine the strength of their throw.
title: Perfect Bowling

description: Golf-kko Open is a golf game. While the golfing mechanics themselves are standard, the game as a whole focuses more on comedy than it does skill or simulation. Each of the three caddies has a distinct personality and often the game encourages the player to perform poorly to trigger a special event.
title: Golf-kko Open

description: King of Kings is a turn-based strategy video game featuring war elements. The game has a campaign mode called "Battle with Lucifer" where you can play against a computer in four scenarios, and a multiplayer mode where you can freely choose a map and play against a computer or another player, up to four players at the same time.
title: King of Kings

description:
Akuu Senki Raijin is a hybrid shoot'em up and four directional mech shooting game for the Famicom Disk System. The story starts with a sudden attack by the machine form Galem in the five subspace relay points known as the "Field". As a respond and to get rid of the threat, the Galactic Union sends the mechanized mobile unit Raijin, controlled by the player.

The Raijin's main gimmick is the ability to transform from a mech unit to a spaceship and vice-versa. Said transformation changes the gameplay from a shooting-adventure game with 4 directional movement and aiming through interconnected single-screen segments (similar to the first Legend of Zelda), to side-scrolling shoot'em up sections with fixed directions. The game also features upgrades in the form of different weapons and shields, which are purchasable along with their ammunition between levels.
title: Akū Senki Raijin

description:
BodyConQuest I: Abakareshi Musume Tachi is an unlicensed eroge parody of the Dragon Quest series for the Famicom Disk System.

On your 14th birthday, you are asked by the king to rescue the princess, a girl with a heart-shaped birthmark. This eventually leads to you rescuing her two sisters, then finally tracking down and defeating the Dragonlord. An ecchi pose is awarded to the player upon rescuing each of three princesses, as well as from a few female NPCs scattered throughout the game. Despite featuring plot elements and graphics directly ripped from Dragon Quest, the game is actually an action-RPG more akin to Hydlide or the Ys series.
title: BodyConQuest I: Abakareshi Musume Tachi

description:
Gekitotsu Yonku Battle ("Yonku Clash Battle") is a top-down vehicular combat game featuring "yonku" cars, miniature RC toy cars consisting of a four-wheel drive system. The player controls one of these yonku cars, and the object is to wipe out the other cars in constant pursuit of the player, either by smashing into them or steering them into hazards. Various power-ups can be collected around the course, and these include temporary invisibility and full health. If the player's car is damaged, their life meter will be depleted, and the game is over if it is empty.

For every car destroyed, a flag appears somewhere on the map. The player can collect this flag for some bonus points. Subsequent destroyed cars increases its value from one to two to three to four. If the value increases again, the flag becomes a crown which is worth five points. The player's "teki" meter decreases as cars are destroyed; once this reaches zero, the player is transported to the next stage. Occasionally, bonus stages appears, and the object of these is to collect as many flags as the player can before time expires.

sample_screenshots.caption: Get this power-up to wipe all opponents on screen

title: Gekitotsu Yonku Battle

description:
Famicom Jump: Hero Retsuden is a JRPG that was only released in Japan for the Famicom. The game was released for the 20th anniversary of the Weekly Shōnen Jump magazine, and features characters and concepts from the many manga series that were being showcased there in the late 80s. You play as Hashimoto, a kid who is a fan of Shōnen Jump. One day, he's whisked away inside a magazine and finds himself in Jump World, where he must stop the many villains from various series trying to conquer it.

Gameplay consists of both real-time action and traditional turn-based battles, and has the typical elements of classic JRPGs: an overworld, towns, recruiting of characters, etc.

These manga series are represented in the game: Astro Kyūdan* (”Team Astro”)

  • Captain Tsubasa Cat’s Eye Chichi no Tamashii (”A Father’s Soul”)
  • Circuit no Ōkami (”The Circuit Wolf”)
  • City Hunter Doberman Deka* (”The Doberman Cop”)
  • Dr. Slump Dragon Ball Hokuto no Ken (”Fist of the North Star”)
  • Ginga: Nagareboshi Gin (”Silver Fang: Shooting Star Gin”)
  • Godsider Harenchi Gakuen* (”Shameless School”)
  • High School! Kimengumi Hōchōnin Ajihei* (”Ajihei the Cook”)
  • JoJo no Kimyō na Bōken (”Jojo’s Bizzare Adventure”)
  • Kenritsu Umisora Kōkō Yakyūbuin Yamashita Tarō-kun (”Taro Yamashita: Member of the Prefectural High School Baseball Team”)
  • Kick Off Kimagure Orange Road *Kinnikuman Kochira Katsushika-ku Kameari Kōen-mae Hashutsujo (”Kochikame: Tokyo Beat Cops”)
  • Kōya no Shonen Isamu (”Isamu: Boy of the Wilderness”)
  • Moeru! Onīsan (”The Burning Wild Man”)
  • Otoko Ippiki Gaki Daishō (”A Shining Example of a Bully”)
  • Ring ni Kakero (”Put it All in the Ring”)
  • Saint Seiya Sakigake!! Otokojuku* (”Charge!! Men’s Private School”)
  • Shape Up Ran The Momotaroh Toilet Hakase (”Professor Toilet”)
  • Tsuide ni Tonchinkan (”Anyway, It Doesn’t Matter”)
  • Wing-Man Yoroshiku Mechadoc*
title: Famicom Jump: Hero Retsuden

description:
Famicom Jump II: Saikyō no Shichinin is a JRPG that was only released in Japan for the Famicom. Just like its predecessor, Famicom Jump: Hero Retsuden, the story takes place in Jump World, a place based on different manga series that were being serialized in the Weekly Shōnen Jump magazine at the time. Four of the represented manga titles from the previous game are present again here, with other three being new to the sequel.

There are seven playable characters. At the beginning of the game you can choose which character to start with. The selected character influences the path the player will take through the characters' universes, beginning from the chosen character's home universe. Gameplay features typical JRPG elements, like an overworld, random battles, and towns to explore and talk to people. Battles are turn-based, but you can move/control your characters on the battlefield.

Playable characters and their respective mangas: Son Goku (Dragon Ball Z*)

  • Ryotsu Kankichi (Kochira Katsushika-ku Kameari Kōen-mae Hashutsujo)
  • Momotaro Tsurugi (Sakigake!! Otokojuku)
  • Jotaro Kujo (JoJo's Bizarre Adventure, replaces Joseph Joestar from the previous game)
  • Ta-chan (Jungle King Tar-chan)
  • Tarurūto (Magical Taluluto)
  • Maeda Taison (Rokudenashi Blues)
title: Famicom Jump II: Saikyō no Shichinin

description:
Dream Master is a Japan-only game released for the Famicom. The story takes place in the kingdom of Oltaria, where an evil wizard has taken the soul of the King's daughter and sent her into a nightmare realm. You play as a titular Dream Master, with the ability to get into people's dreams, and your job is to save the princess.

At the beginning of the game you get to name the Hero and the Princess. Gameplay involves turn-based battles in typical JRPG fashion, facing opponents in a battle screen for the purpose, and also adventure game elements like puzzle-solving, sometimes inventory-based. The game is divided in seven chapters corresponding each to a new dream, usually consisting of a new village to roam around and one or more bosses to eliminate.
title: Dream Master

description: "Monti no Doki Doki Dai Dassō: Monty on the Run" is a remake of the 1985 original platformer and means "Monty's Great Heart-pounding Escape" when translated to English. It was created for the Famicom Disk System in 1987 by Jaleco Ltd. The game bears very little resemblance to the original version. For instance, Monty Mole has been replaced with a human on the run from prison and now has to escape through various Aztec-like temples. The only real association the game does have with the original is Gremlin's copyright and the familiar "in-game" theme playing on the title screen. Like many Famicom Disk System titles, Monty's Great Heart-pounding Escape is little known outside Japan as the game was never ported to cartridge for a Western NES release.
title: Monty no Doki Doki Dai Dassō: Monty on the Run

description:
The authors of various manga artists' pens have been stolen and the player must travel to many worlds to retrieve them. These worlds happen to be popular manga titles that have been published by Nakayoshi magazine. Each world has its respective author that asks the player to retrieve her pen.

Nakayoshi to Issho is a simple RPG with small worlds. However, the battle mechanism is solely based on luck, attacks are determined by a slot machine.
title: Nakayoshi to Issho

description:
Janken Disk Jō features the mascot of the Famicom Disk System, Diskun, as the player. Beginning the game in a village, the player can meet with the King, who will allow Diskun to enter the dungeons to start completing the levels. The protagonist can also interact with other characters around the village.

In the labyrinth, there are monsters resembling the three hand signs from the game Janken, or rock paper scissors. Like the activity in real life, the video game features rock monsters losing to the paper ones, which lose to the scissors ones, which lose to the rock ones. When one monster with a losing sign gets pushed to one with a winning sign (or vice versa), the losing monster will disappear or lose a level of strength. Red monsters turn into yellow, yellow ones becomes green, and green ones vanish when they get pushed next to the stronger monster.

Four bosses are featured in the game. The first three, in order, are the one in the form of paper, the one shaped like scissors, and the one looking like rock. However, the final boss features the use of all three of those signs; which rotate through one at a time. After the last boss, Diskun can meet with the king again, which would end the game.
title: Janken Disk Jō

description:
The Triathron [sic] is a sports simulation game developed and published by K Amusement for the Famicom towards the end of 1988. It simulates the three events contained in a traditional Triathlon including swimming, biking, and running.

The game contains six different athletes to choose from, all with their own variety of strengths and weaknesses, and it contains four official courses based on real world competitions (Chicago, Japan, Paris, and Hawaii), and one "special" course which contains more fantasy elements than the usual courses. After winning a triathlon, the player can invest some points into their chosen competitor's stats and move onto the next.
title: The Triathlon

description:
Animalia Dreamland is a collection platformer with randomized physics. In the lore of the game, the player is trapped in a dream having become one of two animals: a hamster or a bird. In the dream setting, the character's ability to jump is unpredictable. The player must adapt to the controls and collect the four crystal shards in each stage.

There are eighteen level layouts, each of which comes in a summer theme and a slippery winter theme. Both playable animals are able to jump. The bird can additionally glide around or flap to fly. The height and duration of a jump are randomized by default, but in "Lucid Mode" they can be set by the player. In the "Three Dreams" mode, the goal is to complete three stages, and falling into a pit results in the end of the game. In the "Full World" mode, the player must complete all eighteen stages in succession, and falling into a pit simply restarts the current stage. In either case, a successful completion will show the in-game time and icons to indicate which modes were played.
title: Animalia Dreamland

description: An alien invasion is underway in Heian-Kyo city and you are its defenders! NEO Heiankyou Alien is a modern take on Heiankyo Alien where one or two players (cooperatively) must clear each stage from enemies by digging holes and -when an enemy stumbles in- bury them. When a stage is cleared, you move on to the next, with a different layout and occasionally new types of baddies. The original version of Heiankyo Alien has also been ported from the arcade and is included. Several chiptune artists have contributed music tracks for the game and a music player is available in the main menu so that players can enjoy any piece independently.

sample_screenshots.caption: In later stages, new enemies appear, like this yellow type.
There is a short intro with images and japanese text.
Main menu. From here you can play the modern game, the classic game or go to the music menu to enjoy some chiptunes.
Number of players? Two players can play simultaneously and cooperatively.

title: NEO Heiankyo Alien

description:
Best Keiba: Derby Stallion is a simulation game which focuses not only on horse races, but on producing and training racehorses as well. Thus it has something from managerial game. The stage is a ranch, stables, and racetrack. Initially, it starts with one breeding mare and 15 million yen in funding. The first given breeding mare is of course the lowest class.

Horse maintenance costs are 100,000 yen for each horse on a farm and 400,000 yen for each horse in a stable. This fee is collected at the beginning of each month. When the funds reach zero, the game ends with bankruptcy.

Of the basic parameters of a racehorse, four are directly related to racing: speed, stamina, temperament, and competitive spirit. Furthermore, performance changes depending on factors such as sturdiness, fatigue recovery, condition, horse weight, and growth rate. If you have a bad temper, you'll be late, or you'll waste your stamina by moving ahead without following the instructions on the way. If you have a fighting spirit, it will be easier to win when competing in a straight line. If it is highly durable, it is less likely to break down during training or racing. There will also be fewer cases of athletes becoming unwell after a race. If you have a high level of recovery, it will be easier to overcome fatigue after a race, and you will be able to run tougher even if you run repeatedly at short intervals. The condition of a horse is what is called a biorhythm, and no matter how capable a horse may be, if it is put into a race when it is not in good shape, it will not be able to fully demonstrate its potential. Each type has a different peak time, with early maturing being around the middle of 4 years of age, normal being late 5 years of age, and late maturing around 7 years of age. Horses might by injured during races and in such cases they are excluded from next races. In extreme situations, when prognosis are poor, horse can be euthanized.
title: Best Keiba: Derby Stallion

description:
All 1, or Famimaga Disk Vol. 3: All 1, is a puzzle game in which the player controls a ladybug pushing over a dice. The stage is cleared if all the numbers are set to 1. A scaled map is displayed on the right, and an enlarged map is displayed on the left. There are also obstacles such as rocks and other objects that get in the way of rolling, and the flower garden where you cannot roll the dice.

The feature of this game is that the objects you move are dice. Since it's a die, the numbers change each time you move (roll) it. The key to complete the stage is to set each die to 1. The basic view is from above. A front view window is also displayed at the same time, to help you to understand the structure of the cube. There are often few paths to clear the stage, but sometimes there is only one way to do it and then you will need to restart the stage on any mistake.
title: All 1

description:
After winning the World Cup for Japan, Tsubasa Ōzora moves to Brazil with his coach Roberto Hongo. In this episode, Tsubasa tries to help São Paulo FC win the Brazilian National Tournament. While playing the story mode the player must win each match to progress. If the player loses, he must have a rematch with the previous team.

Captain Tsubasa II: Super Striker is a football (soccer) simulation game. There are different types of moves players can take in the game. Players have the option to dribble, shoot, block, or do nothing.
title: Captain Tsubasa II: Super Striker

description:
The fourth Famicom Jajamaru-kun game (“Legend of the Demon Attack Jajamaru: The Illusionary Golden Demon Castle”) is an action-RPG that borrows heavily from the original Zelda game. Each section contains a small map, which commonly comprises a few towns and dungeons. It offers a sense of non-linearity, however you still need to face all of the events in a particular sequence.

The levels are all simplistic mazes, and there’s not many puzzles. You just run around and hit bad guys until you find the stairs to the next level. In addition to your normal chain weapon, you can purchase shurikens, and in time you acquire many jutsu techniques. The cartoonish tone of the previous games has been discarded in favor of a more serious atmosphere.
title: Jajamaru Gekimaden: Maboroshi no Kinmajō

description: Tōkon Club is a wrestling game where the player can control one of the 8 wrestlers on one-on-one fights against the CPU or against a second player.
title: Tōkon Club

description: During a sea-based conflict, the player takes personal command of a naval fleet of battleships, aircraft carriers, frigates, patrol boats, and submarines to eliminate the opposing fleet. The game requires the player to move a naval unit across the sea for a limited distance, or otherwise attack an enemy vessel on each turn. Enemies remain invisible until they are within a unit’s sight range.
title: Fleet Commander

description:
In the kingdom of Palmeccia, the royal couple have been murdered on the orders of the evil Ragon. Years later, the orphaned prince of Palmeccia, travels across the world of Minelvaton, seeking to become a Light Warrior and avenge his parents.

The game plays in a typical JRPG fashion with random battles, grinding experience for leveling up, various dungeons with treasure, and towns with services. The inventory system is divided into multiple categories. Items are miscellaneous objects, potions are for recovery, relics are key items, and equipment serves as armor and weapons. The player can have only two characters join the princes’s party. Random battles have dynamic movement for enemies and characters, but turn-based combat with only the prince being controllable and the rest fighting automatically.
title: Minelvaton Saga: Ragon no Fukkatsu

description: Super Homebrew War is a brawling game developed for the NESDev 2018 competition. It is a crossover fighting game that uses characters from many other NES homebrew games.
title: Super Homebrew War

description: Uchūsen: Ultimate Ploid Battle is a horizontally-scrolling arcade shoot 'em-up game with Metroidvania elements. The game was made in one day. the player controls a spaceship named ship Kairos and fights against the invasion of the alien race of Uchusen.
title: Uchūsen

description:
Daiku no Gen-san 2: Akage no Dan no Gyakushō is a 2D platformer and the 2nd entry in the Hammerin' Harry series. Dan the Red has returned and he wants vengeance for his embarrassment thanks to the efforts of Harry. He can’t go head to head with Harry, but he knows where to strike him where it hurts the most - capturing Donna! What’s more, he’s also kidnapped Harry’s father while taking orders from Dr. Parallel who seems to have grand designs for the whole town.

Bigger than before, you will direct Harry through eight levels to get to the bottom of Dan’s devious plans and find out what it is he has planned.
title: Daiku no Gen-san 2: Akage no Dan no Gyakushō

description:
Your distant uncle has passed away, leaving you, his heir, with a fortune of billions of dollars. The catch? The Benedict family has extremely high standards, and you have to prove that you can make that fortune even larger on the stock market before it will be given to you. In addition, you must exercise regularly to stay healthy, and keep your girlfriend happy by pampering her frequently with gifts.
