The game features a stock trading engine that is fairly simple to jump into. Buy stocks as you see fit, and finish the day. The next morning, you will find out whether your assets grew or not. If they didn't, you most likely need to invest in something else.

sample_screenshots.caption: Main game window - from here you can read the newspaper, take Prisila out, exercise, and more
I wasn't able to raise a million dollars by the due date
You receive a call from Ralph, the real estate agent

title: Wall Street Kid

description:
In The Money Game II the story is divided into two chapters.

In the first chapter, an old man approaches the protagonist, Minase, and offers him a two million yen investment to turn it into ten million by trading stocks. And he has one month to do it. If the player succeeds in that amazing feat, they move on to the next chapter where Minase is challenged by another trader to see who can turn 5 million yen into 1 billion within three months.
title: The Money Game II: Kabutochō no Kiseki

sample_screenshots.caption: First stage - shoot drones to drop power-ups

description:
Nix: The Paradox Relic is a platform game inspired by games like Mega Man, Metroid, and Castlevania. The player assumes the role of Nix, a bounty hunter of the Caniden species (anthropomorphic Canidae).

The main character receives a bounty on two space pirates hiding in an abandoned research facility, built into the side of an asteroid.
title: Nix: The Paradox Relic

description:
Columbus: Ōgon no Yoake is an RPG simulation focused on a fantastical depiction of the life and exploits of the explorer Christopher Columbus, The story of the game is broken up by different eras of Columbus's life, covering his early life. then exploring around Europe as a young adult, gaining experience levels and taking missions from kings to gain fame, and finally setting sail to find a new route to Asia and ultimately discovering the New World.

Columbus sails around Euro[pe visiting port towns where he can buy equipment and supplies and chat with the locals. Exploring on land or sea however can land Columbus into a battle. While combat is turn-based, its slightly more in depth as players have to take movement into account to get in range of their opponents. Columbus can eventually hire two crewmen to help him in these battles.

The game has both a Normal Mode and the Historical Mode. The only difference is in Historical Mode, time is a factor. The game must be beaten before the year 1493 starts with time passing counted by every step Columbus makes. There is also a mode where players can practice sailing route missions of various difficulties.
title: Columbus: Ōgon no Yoake

description:
Bingo 75 is a slot machine simulator game. What differs it from many other similar games is that after you win several times the double up mini-game you will be rewarded with adult content - pictures of a woman undressing.

To begin the game you need to insert coins to get credit. To do that press B to gain 100 credits each time and then press A to bet. The first bet will place 1 credit on 1st row, next bet will place credit on 2nd row and so on, but the highest bet is 5 credits in each row. By pressing A or B you may bet Small or bet Big. Each time you win such bet the girl from the picture will lose a piece of her clothing.
title: Bingo 75

description: Hidden Chinese Chess is a game based on a variation of Chinese Chess known as Dark Chess or Banqi. Unlike traditional Chinese Chess, this game is played on a smaller 4x8 grid and involves uncovering hidden pieces and capturing the opponent's general.
title: Hidden Chinese Chess

description:
A compilation of the following four games on one cartridge:

  • Arctic Adventure
  • Math Quiz
  • Jackpot
  • Galactic Crusader
title: Mindblower Pak

description: Chess Academy is based on the board game Xiangqi, also known as "Chinese chess". There are two modes: Exercise and Match. In Exercise mode you get short instructions about the rules. You will learn that Chinese chess has total 32 chessmen. Two same chessmen are called "One Pair", three - "Three of a kind". Particular combinations are called "Straight". You must collect "Three of a kind" and "One Pair" or "One Straight" and "One Pair".
title: Chess Academy

description: Chinese Checkers is based on the board game of the same name. It is up to two human players, total number of players is three. Pawns of each player are marked in three different colors: pink, blue and green. The aim is to move all your pawns from one end of the board to the other end. Ends of the board match with the color of your pawns. In this version you do not capture a pawn, but you just jump over opponents' and yours pawns. The player who first brings all his pawns to the other side of the board - wins.
title: Chinese Checkers

description: Chinese KungFu is a beat 'em up game that takes place in Ancient China. It is one or two players game. Rules are simple - there is one or two of you and a lot of opponents. You must fight them to reach the next location. It has 5 levels divided into 4 sections. Second section is a platform type section and fourth section is a fight with a boss. You have 2 lives and energy bar placed in the bottom of the screen.
title: Chinese KungFu

description:
Shin 4-nin Uchi Mahjong: Yakuman Tengoku is a Reach Mahjong game. There are two game modes: world mode and free mode. In world mode players compete in a championship traveling to different towns around the world, from Kyoto to Moscow, Paris, New Delhi, Hong Kong, Rio, and Las Vegas. There are four selectable characters available, and the choice affects the gameplay. Each match puts the player against three computer controlled opponents. In free mode, players can choose their opponents.

The game has a battery back up feature so players can save their characters and progress.

sample_screenshots.caption: The world map, you start at Kyoto

title: Shin 4-nin Uchi Mahjong: Yakuman Tengoku

description:
Tanigawa Kōji no Shōgi Shinan III is the third installment in the Shōgi simulation series endorsed by Kōji Tanigawa.

The game features the following modes:

  • Taikyoku: an exhibition mode
  • Meijinsen: a game against Kōji Tanigawa, if the player wins four games the game is beaten
  • Hasami Shōgi
  • Slot Shōgi
  • Watch a real recorded game
title: Tanigawa Kōji no Shōgi Shinan III

description:
Jikai Shōnen Met Mag is a 2D puzzle-platformer with a central polarity gimmick. The player's objective is to gather orbs placed throughout out a stage before heading to the exit. There are magnetized red and blue blocks in each stage that interact with the player's character in opposite ways, depending on the player's character's polarity. Opposite colors attract, same colors repel. Picking up items change the player's polarity. The player can use the interactions with magnetized blocks to their advantage by boosting jump height or to climb across the ceiling. The game contains 100 stages.

At the start of the game, the player can choose to play as a boy or a girl, which also changes the title screen accordingly. The boy always starts each stage with blue polarity. The girl always starts each stage with red polarity.
title: Jikai Shōnen Met Mag

description: The Famicom Disk System version of Yōkai Yashiki is a completely different game. While the original's basic premise of playing a boy looking for his sister in a ghost manor is retained and the flashlight mechanic is kept, everything else is different. All the stages are different, all the sprites are different, all the bosses other than the first one are different. Most notably, this version is no longer a Metroidvania since the ability to freely backtrack to previous stages has been removed, the stage progression is entirely linear.
title: Yōkai Yashiki

description: Although legally an adaptation of the movie Major League (1989), this game is a simple baseball simulation, devoid of the comedy which audiences know the original movie for.
title: Major League

sample_screenshots.caption: Pick up hearts to refill health

description: The Famicom Disk System version of Titanic: The Recovery Mission keeps the same story premise and gameplay loop between the dive gameplay and above water gameplay, but changes the perspective to third person. The player is given a choice of three female divers to play: Momoko, Marlene (the woman on the cover) and Reika. The game starts on July 1st and you have until September to finish the mission.
title: Titanic Mystery: Ao no Senritsu

description:
Following the Minelvaton Saga, the hero player is tasked with a trial to become the "Warrior of the Gods" and journey through Minelvaton to the land of Pantheon to bring down the dark god Zuhl.

The typical JPRG mechanics in this game include a Town Mode, Outdoor Mode, Dungeon Mode and Battle Mode. In Town Mode, the player can interact with eight menu commands, buy and sell items or get services from shops, accept sidequests from NPCs, and hire mercenaries. Additional party members are progressive, who enter and leave the party depending on the progress of the plot. Battle Mode is randomly entered in the Outdoor and Dungeon Modes. In the Battle Mode, the player uses a menu to initiate moves (attack, spells, formation, etc.). When gaining a level, a party member gets random stat increases and learns new spells. The player can also make use of idols, which are fragile and may require maintenance, but have significant magic powers.
title: Silva Saga

description: Irem's Mahjong Kazoku is a 1v1 mahjong game, despite the cover depicting 4 players at the mahjong table. The game has 4 modes: tutorial mode where the player get hints on the next move, standard mahjong mode, good-hand mode where both the player and the AI are dealt good hands with high chance of going out early and scrambled-hand mode, where the tiles in your hand are not sorted whatsoever.
title: Mahjong Kazoku

description:
In the distant future, humans have migrated to planet Ival, ruled over by the god Byrn. The period of peace under his rule came to an end when demons took away the source of his power - the titular Light of Indra - and Byrn falls into a deep slumber, leaving the surface of the planet infested by monsters.

Taking after Dragon Quest, this early Japanese-style RPG puts you in the shoes of a young warrior on Ival starting out on a simple quest to procure a remedy for his ailing Princess. The game follows a similar gameplay loop of battling enemies for experience points and money, going back to town to buy better gears, getting stronger to fighter stronger enemies. Unlike the constantly-centered hero of Dragon Quest, Indora no Hikari adopts a fixed top-down view similar to The Legend of Zelda. Indora no Hikari is also one of the earliest Famicom games to utilize save batteries as opposed to the popular password system at the time of its release.
title: Indora no Hikari

description:
Sukeban Deka makes it way to the Famicom in the first and only game for the system. This game is an adaptation of the third season of the Sukeban Deka live-action TV series. The new yo-yo slinger to take up the mantle of Saki Asamiya is Yui Kazama. And this time, she is not alone. Joining her sisters Yuka and Yuma, they are tasked with combating a psychic terrorist and his army.

Sukeban Deka III gives you control over all 3 Kazama sisters from the TV show, who each have slightly different sprites. The game starts in an overhead free-roaming stage, but subsequently switches to side-scrolling perspective in the following stages. Though mostly a standard beat 'em up, the game has some light RPG elements. Each sister - who you can switch out as the active character at any moment - has her own level and ninja arts and they gain experience individually.
title: Sukeban Deka III

description: This simple golf game offers a 18-hole course to clear. Aside from standard stroke game, Golf Club: Birdie Rush has a tournament mode where you have AI-controlled opponents to compete against and 2-player hotseat multiplayer versions of both modes. There is also a match game mode exclusive for 2-player where a point is awarded per hole for the player that scores the fewer strokes.
title: Golf Club: Birdie Rush
